column4:
Executive Assistant
·        Independently completes the full range of advanced administrative activities, in support of one or more executives, who are responsible for leading a small business unit or group and generally Level S. Interactions are sometimes at the leadership level. Appropriately and effectively addresses highly complex issues escalated to assigned executive's office/team. 
·        Schedules meetings, prepares and distributes meeting agendas and minutes.  Makes travel arrangements and maintains calendar of appointments for assigned executive(s) and/or team. Exercises autonomy in anticipating a diverse range of highly complex issues and troubleshooting these issues as they arise.
·        Manages supply orders and resolves associated issues on behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team. 
·        Responsible for the timeliness, quality and accurate completion of own work as well as effective collaboration with leadership and the executive's direct reports/wider team on behalf of the executive. 
·        Uses a wide range of business software applications (Microsoft Word, PPT, Excel, Outlook, etc.) to conduct assigned activities such as the preparation of correspondence, reports, presentations, agendas, minutes, etc. 
·        Activities include calendar management, meeting planning, travel booking, expense reporting, filing, mail/courier arrangements, data entry, document management services, records management and other related areas.   
·        Additional administrative functions such as print production, mail services or conference room setup. Independently completes the full range of advanced administrative activities, in support of one or more executives (Level S), who are responsible for leading a small business unit or group. 
·        Supports executive(s) in completing activities required for the management of teams responsible for similar tasks.  The assistant's tasks are frequently diverse, highly complex in nature and may include but are not limited to, calendar management, travel booking, expense reporting, word processing, data entry.  
·        Effectively prioritizes the needs of the office, executive(s) and/or team as prescribed by established guidelines, managing competing requests and switching focus as needed; often must negotiate prioritization of administrative activities with/among higher level team members/managers. Evaluates non-standard problems and uses judgement to develop appropriate solutions or procedures. 
·        Operates independently and effectively with a significant degree of time management and work method/approach latitude. Responsible for daily interaction and management of communication with the assigned executive's/team member's direct reports. Interactions are sometimes at the leadership level. Appropriately and effectively addresses highly complex issues escalated to assigned executive's office/team. 
·        May participate in ad-hoc special projects or administrative initiatives.  May serve as a support team lead, assigning activities to  other support staff and checking completion. S/he will need to be proactive in their duties and not necessarily look for direction on every item.   
·        Must also work well under pressure.
·        Performs advanced, diversified and often confidential administrative duties requiring broad and comprehensive experience, skill and knowledge of organizational policies and procedures. 
Screens calls and visitors, and resolves inquiries.   Qualifications
High school/secondary school or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required; bachelor’s degree preferred.
Applicable vocational training (e.g., courses on relevant business software like the Microsoft Office Suite of products, basic business writing, or similar) preferred; AA degree or relevant business certifications preferred. 
Where proficiency in standard activities within a professional discipline is pertinent (e.g., Human Resources, Finance, etc.), relevant degree or industry certifications for the discipline are desirable.
5-7 years of total work experience preferred.  
Bachelor's degree in lieu of some experience may be considered.
  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.  Primary Location: United States-New York-New York Internal Jobcode: 76003 Job: Information Technology Organization: Asset Servicing Technology-HR07302 Requisition Number: 1901520

column4: Sr. Specialist Systems Engineer/Programmer->> Leads the design and development of highly complex application problems, system administration issues, or network concerns. Performs systems management and integration functions. Conducts and leads analysis to correct systems, applications, software, and hardware that are not compliant with Corporate policy/procedures. Works closely with external vendors on large infrastructure engineering projects. Works closely with Application Development and Quality Assurance and Testing teams to understand infrastructure needs during the development and testing processes. Applies IT expertise in strategizing how to best develop infrastructure that will allow development and testing processes to be secure and efficient.Provides input and recommends processes in developing project plans. Monitors project progress and provides regular status reports to management team. Evaluates the effectiveness of the organization's existing infrastructure technology. Stays informed of current industry trends and emerging technologies. Researches and analyzes trends to recommend and implement upgrades that enhance the reliability and efficiency of the IT infrastructure. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required, advanced degree is preferred.Eight to ten (8-10) years of related experience is required.Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column4:
The Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) group is
responsible for building technology to support three of the most critical
services of BNY Mellon – US Govt Securities Clearance, US Triparty Repo and
Global Collateral Management. These platforms are responsible for clearing and
settling equity and fixed-income transactions in markets around the globe, and
managing more than $3 trillion in global collateral.
 
The group is transforming itself into a data-centric
organization and we are seeking strong technologists who can adapt to a dynamic
and fast-paced work environment. If you thrive on solving problems, thinking
critically and creating change, we want you to be a part of our team!
 
Join us in our journey and we’ll together build the
financial services industry’s next-generation data services platform.

Responsibilities:

As a member of the team, you will be responsible for
building and enhancing Java platforms that provide critical data services for
our businesses. You will be expected to design application modules, build test
suites, analyze business requirements and propose innovative technology
solutions. You will also actively liaise with multiple stakeholders and users
to define the direction of the platforms.    Principal Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support. Provides comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staffs. Evaluates compliance with the organization's technology standards. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Guides and consults with IT management and technical staffs regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services. Participates in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 10-12 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.  Qualifications BS
/ MS (Computer Science, Math, Engineering)10+
years overall experienceStrong
CS fundamentals, core Java, multithreading and problem-solving skills are
requiredExperience
building distributed high-performance, high-availability systemsExperience
with and strong understanding of capital markets is preferredExperience
working in a strong agile environment is preferred
BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Team and the new
generation platform The Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) group is
responsible for building technology to support three of the most critical
services of BNY Mellon - US Govt Securities Clearance, US Triparty Repo and
Global Collateral Management. These platforms are responsible clearing and
settling equity and fixed-income transactions in markets around the globe, and
managing more than $3 trillion in global collateral.The group is building solutions to help our clients in security
master sourcing, optimization and high-performance real-time transaction
processing. To meet new market challenges and provide new functionality
to our clients, our group is working on building the next generation platform.
The new platform will be mission-critical, high-performance, high-availability,
and will include big-data, machine-learning analytics capabilities. The work environment is fast-paced with very high levels of
collaboration with global product managers.  Role
We are looking for strong developers who are excited about
building this next generation system. They will have the unique opportunity to
build a sophisticated high performance security master system using the latest
technology stack and best software engineering practices. They will become the members
of the core team driving it forward and will have a significant impact in how
it’s implemented. 

Specialist Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Coordinates coding, testing, implementation and documentation of solution. Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 6-8 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
 Qualifications
BS (Computer Science, Math, Physics,
Engineering) 1-3 years application development experienceGood CS fundamentals, core Java, multithreading and
problem solving skills are requiredExposure to distributed system development in
the Financial Industry is preferredExposure to working in an agile environment is
preferred

 
 
 
For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. These enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions and leading-edge infrastructure. We are looking for a strong Java/JEE Developer to be a core member of our Web Development team. The job involves designing, developing and supporting enterprise and custom solutions supported by strong web experience and skills. We are also looking for a candidate who can bring experience working directly with clients and with cloud architectures.   We make use of Liferay as a core product, so any experience in this product or any other portal platform is desired but not mandatory. A willingness to learn about Liferay is a must.   Responsibilities: Design, develop and support a range of web-based Java applications, primarily based on Liferay, but also using other proven advanced technologies.Develop and enhance testing strategies for all applications.Collaborate with other developer team members on best practices, code reviews, internal tools and process improvements.  Write readable, maintainable, and efficient code.Work with our platform engineers to develop the platforms to which we deploy our applications.Work with clients to understand their requirements and offer suitable solutions considering technology, budgets and time constraints. Qualifications BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related
field required. Advanced technical degree and/or related training a plus.Strong Java/JEE skills and object-oriented
design experience, including working knowledge of the Java web technology
platform, applied use of design patterns, and MVC technologies.Experience designing and implementing web
applications.Knowledge of portal development required.
Knowledge of JSR 168,JSR 286 and OSGi an advantage.Experience of Liferay preferred but not
mandatory. Experience of other Portal software useful. Must be capable of
adapting to using Liferay.Knowledge of session management, object
relational mapping, web services (SOAP and REST), and agile development
methodologies desired.Experience with web server and app server
configuration desired.An ability to work independently; designing,
developing and deploying solutions with minimal direction.Solid verbal and written communication skills. Java Development

NEXEN is BNY Mellon's next-generation technology platform that consists of seven core components among others including private cloud, API store exposed to the clients and building blocks for frontend layer. 

AIS Nexen project is simply set of services making use of the above to deliver our internal and external clients tools to manage all kinds of investment funds. Apart functional projects we plan to migrate to newer version of Angular.

Team:


Location: USA, Poland, India
Size: 20 Devs (divided into smaller teams)
Office hours: ~9-17 
Travels: no
Work from home policy: on ad-hoc basis and irregular


Tech stack and tools:


Frontend:  AngularJS (1.2), Angular (5+), Bootstrap (v3.3.7), Angular Material 
Backend:  Java (1.8), Spring, Spring Integration, Spring Batch (4.3), Spring
Boot and OAuth 2
Deployment: private cloud infrastructure (VMs or containers), Docker,Jenkins, Sonar
Code Repository: GitLab
Development and knowledge base: IntelliJ, JIRA, Confluence, Scrum


Profile:


Design: 20% 
Development: 60% 
Tests: 10%
Support and maintenance/bug fixing: 10%

 Qualifications
What skills you should demonstrate:
 
 • Java 8, Spring 4+, Spring Integration, Spring Batch, Spring Boot, Spring MVC 
 • Apache Tomcat, PL/SQL, Maven, Mockito 
 • Formal education in Computer Science or Engineering 
 • Strong communication skills  
  What we can offer you:Full time contract of employmentCompetitive salaryHealth & Life InsuranceMultisport card / Cinema Tickets / Nursery subsidiaryPension schemeExcellent opportunities for training, growth and professional developmentOpportunities to engage in diverse projects due to growth of business migrationsA multitude of opportunities to get involved in additional charity projectsA collaborative culture and great teams

If you feel that this role is exactly what you are looking for, feel free to apply!

Tech Lead - Applications Development>> Provides application software development services or technical support in situations of moderate complexity. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. Manages a small team of Developers, including but not restricted to PMP & Compensation related activities. Writes new programs of moderate complexity and scope, working with basic application system designs and specifications, utilizing BNY Mellon's standard development methodology, procedures and techniques. Designs and codes programs, and creates test transactions and runs tests to find errors and revise programs. Prepares the final and detailed versions of system modification requirements and ensures turnovers are done on time and correctly. Interfaces with architects to design, code, test and implement application programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Supervises a team by providing instruction, making assignments, directing and checking the work of applications developers. Provides training in technical tools and skills, as well as specific applications and their business functions to maximize their contribution. Completes final testing for conformance to standards and adherence to design specifications. Provides application and user support, troubleshooting, application testing, and post-implementation review of new/changed applications. Develops, enhances, and maintains quality application systems to support the client area. Manages a small development team. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 4-6 years of experience in software development required. Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle. The Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) group is
responsible for building technology to support three of the most critical
services of BNY Mellon – US Govt Securities Clearance, US Triparty Repo and
Global Collateral Management. These platforms are responsible for clearing and
settling equity and fixed-income transactions in markets around the globe, and
managing more than $3 trillion in global collateral.
 
The group is transforming itself into a data-centric
organization and we are seeking strong technologists who can adapt to a dynamic
and fast-paced work environment. If you thrive on solving problems, thinking
critically and creating change, we want you to be a part of our team!
 
Join us in our journey and we’ll together build the
financial services industry’s next-generation data services platform.

Responsibilities:

As a member of the team, you will be responsible for
building and enhancing Java platforms that provide critical data services for
our businesses. You will be expected to design application modules, build test
suites, analyze business requirements and propose innovative technology
solutions. You will also actively liaise with multiple stakeholders and users
to define the direction of the platforms.    Principal Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support. Provides comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staffs. Evaluates compliance with the organization's technology standards. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Guides and consults with IT management and technical staffs regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services. Participates in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 10-12 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.  Qualifications BS
/ MS (Computer Science, Math, Engineering)10+
years overall experienceStrong
CS fundamentals, core Java, multithreading and problem-solving skills are
requiredExperience
building distributed high-performance, high-availability systemsExperience
with and strong understanding of capital markets is preferredExperience
working in a strong agile environment is preferred

and will include big-data, machine-learning analytics capabilities. The work environment is fast-paced with very high levels of
collaboration with global product managers.  Role

building this next generation system. They will have the unique opportunity to
build a sophisticated high performance security master system using the latest
technology stack and best software engineering practices. They will become the members
of the core team driving it forward and will have a significant impact in how
it’s implemented.

NEXEN is BNY Mellon's next-generation technology platform that consists of seven core components among others including private cloud, API store exposed to the clients and building blocks for frontend layer. 

AIS Nexen project is simply set of services making use of the above to deliver our internal and external clients tools to manage all kinds of investment funds. Apart functional projects we plan to migrate to newer version of Angular.

Team:


Location: USA, Poland, India
Size: 20 Devs (divided into smaller teams)
Office hours: ~9-17 
Travels: no
Work from home policy: on ad-hoc basis and irregular

Boot and OAuth 2

We are assembling a development team to execute the EMEA AST’s strategy aiming to radically reshape the technology landscape in Asset Servicing by leveraging some of the latest&greatest technology and architectural principles.  The whole development team is going to be placed in Wroclaw, including Dev Manager and Business Analyst and they will be busy with
re-engineering from the ground
up some
of the most critical
systems
within the Asset Servicing Technology to migrate them into the cloud and design
with modern architectural principles in-mind (micro-services etc.)

 A chance to make a huge impact on the technology footprint and the way we develop code in AST  

 Cross-functional team and strong inclination towards Agile techniques  

Ideal candidates:


 Strong, independent seniors who want to make the world a better place ... or at least to change the world around them and leave some legacy 

 Technically strong individuals who see themselves as technical leaders or even who wants to move into management at some point in their career as this team will be a focal points of all the AST endeavors in the near future

Enterprise Financial Messaging (EFM) Core Messaging Applications (CMA) group provides gateway processing and communication with external financial networks including FED, CHIPS, and  SWIFT. These gateway applications service multiple back-office applications’ financial payments and messages, with daily volumes over 1M transactions, with aggregate value over $2T daily. 
   
 The Financial Network Integration (FNI) application within the CMA group is one of three alternative processing pathways to SWIFT, ensuring BNYM has vendor diversity thereby reducing vendor concentration risk, and is based on ACI Worldwide’s Money Transfer System (MTS) along with BNYM-developed integration layer and MTS customizations.

·       Experience developing web applications using Angular 4+, and preferably Angular 6
·       Experience developing in Angular.js and ideally integrating and transitioning to Angular 2+
·       HTML,CSS and Typescript hands-on experience to build UI for web applications
·       Experience writing clean, modular, debuggable TypeScript code using external libraries or custom code
·       Experience working with external libraries for building interactive data visualizations – Highcharts, D3, or others.
·       Experience developing unit tests for UI using Karma, Protractor and other similar UI testing frameworks
·       Experience building and consuming JSON-based RESTful APIs
·       Experience with relational databases and SQL
·       Experience working with JIRA, GIT, Jenkins, and Confluence
·       Experience working in an Agile team environment. 
·       Experience developing back-end Restful services in Java or .Net.
·       Nice to have experience deploying applications in container based cloud environment
Preference for those with experience in the financial services industry, knowledge of securities processing, accounting data, performance measurement, and/or portfolio risk a plus
  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Senior Specialist Project/Program Manager  (Technology Delivery, Agile, PMO Tools)
column4:
Responsible for the program portfolio management, executive reporting,  governance and oversight of  controls 

 Provide analytics to support business and technology stakeholders at all management levels 

 Leads a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. 

 May allocate/coordinate work within projects.  

 Manages and oversees end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). 

 Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the work structure. 

 Assists in developing detailed project plans and schedules application/infrastructure projects, including goals, risks and resource allocation. 

 Monitors project results for significant deviations. 

 Contributes to vendor and client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. 

 Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. 

 May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. 

 Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. 

 May coordinate resources across organizational boundaries. 

 Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. 

 Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. 

 Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. 

 Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. 
 
 
 
 
 
Sr. Specialist Project/Program Manager->> Leads and provides some direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the Work Structure. Develops detailed project plans and schedules application/infrastructure projects, including goals, risks and resource allocation. Monitors project results for significant deviations. Manages vendor and client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. May coordinate resources across organizational boundaries. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial, 8 - 10 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus.
 


 Prior experience in technology delivery process, managing projects and understanding of Agile 

 Prior experience with PMO tools (Portfolio & Project Management, production bugs, defect tracking, risk, etc.) 

 Prior experience developing analytics, report visualization  and complex excel spreadsheets   For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.Pershing provides critical business process, financial and technology solutions for financial organizations around the globe. 
 
We operate behind the scenes to power transformational change for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, independent financial advisers, hedge fund and '40 Act fund managers and individual investors. 
 
We strive to be innovators, developing open architecture technology and financial solutions to support our customers' growth. We advocate on behalf of our customers and help them respond to regulatory reform and drive positive outcomes for our industry and investors.
 
From our core business as an industry-leading trade execution, clearing and custody provider, we have evolved into a global multifaceted firm that provides investment solutions, forward-thinking technology-driven efficiencies, practice management and service excellence.BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. EMEA AST Development
We are assembling a development team to execute the EMEA AST’s strategy aiming to radically reshape the technology landscape in Asset Servicing by leveraging some of the latest&greatest technology and architectural principles.  The whole development team is going to be placed in Wroclaw, including Dev Manager and Business Analyst and they will be busy with
re-engineering from the ground
up some
of the most critical
systems
within the Asset Servicing Technology to migrate them into the cloud and design
with modern architectural principles in-mind (micro-services etc.) 
 
Selling points:


 A chance to make a huge impact on the technology footprint and the way we develop code in AST  

 Cross-functional team and strong inclination towards Agile techniques  

Ideal candidates:


 Strong, independent seniors who want to make the world a better place ... or at least to change the world around them and leave some legacy 

 Technically strong individuals who see themselves as technical leaders or even who wants to move into management at some point in their career as this team will be a focal points of all the AST endeavors in the near future  

What you will do:


 Design and implement green field web application in Angular.  

 Perform hands-on development tasks on daily basis 

 Use effectively modern development approaches such as functional reactive programming, redux architecture, micro service architecture etc. 

 Be significant part of entire SDLC process (frequently working on backend side as well) 
 Qualifications What we expect from you:

Deep knowledge and extensive hands-on experience with object oriented and functional JavaScript
Proven software design skills
Very accurate knowledge and deep understanding of frontend technologies such as Angular, HTML5 and CSS
Excitement for the latest trends in modern web development
Ability to work with minimum supervision
Have strong motivation to introduce myriad of own ideas and approaches
Expected skills:

Strong professional experience with Angular development with Typescript
Extensive knowledge of JavaScript (ECMA6+)
Professional experience with REST architecture
Experience with functional/functional reactive programming
Excellent communication skills
Keen on to learning new technologies What we can offer you:Full time contract of employmentCompetitive salaryHealth & Life InsuranceMultisport card / Cinema Tickets / Nursery subsidiaryPension schemeExcellent opportunities for training, growth and professional developmentOpportunities to engage in diverse projects due to growth of business migrationsA multitude of opportunities to get involved in additional charity projectsA collaborative culture and great teams

Enterprise Financial Messaging (EFM) Core Messaging Applications (CMA) group provides gateway processing and communication with external financial networks including FED, CHIPS, and  SWIFT. These gateway applications service multiple back-office applications’ financial payments and messages, with daily volumes over 1M transactions, with aggregate value over $2T daily. 
   
 The Financial Network Integration (FNI) application within the CMA group is one of three alternative processing pathways to SWIFT, ensuring BNYM has vendor diversity thereby reducing vendor concentration risk, and is based on ACI Worldwide’s Money Transfer System (MTS) along with BNYM-developed integration layer and MTS customizations. 
 
Sr. Specialist Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
 
Roles & Responsibilities:


 Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology.          

 Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group.  

 Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. 
Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools.
Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions.
Level 3 Production Support as needed. Qualifications  Preferred Skills:

Oracle SQL

IBM WebSphere MQ
Familiarity with SWIFT messages types and processing

 Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required

column2: Senior Specialist Web Application Developer -  Angular
column3:
Multiple Locations:
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Jersey City, New Jersey
column4:
Senior Specialist Web Application Developer -  Angular
 
This position is for an experienced/senior Angular developer who will work on one or more GRS application development initiatives.  The GRS team is responsible for many highly visible products so the candidate will have the opportunity to work on multiple initiatives including clean-slate development and re-platforming efforts.  The candidate will play a key role in driving the execution of these efforts.  The ideal candidate has full stack development experience, either in Java or .net, and background in the investment management or more general financial services industry. 
 
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
 
Primary Job Responsibilities:
·       Partner with Business and Technology stakeholders to understand business use case and designs solutions for the use cases.
·       Design/develop/code end-to-end distributed technology solutions in line with enterprise standards
o   Leverage and utilize enterprise and reusable solutions and services to gain efficiencies and consistencies
·       Unit testing and deployment
·       Application deployment
·       Third level Support of deployed applications
  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
·       Looking for 4-8 years of experience in web application development
·       Experience developing web applications using Angular 4+, and preferably Angular 6
·       Experience developing in Angular.js and ideally integrating and transitioning to Angular 2+
·       HTML,CSS and Typescript hands-on experience to build UI for web applications
·       Experience writing clean, modular, debuggable TypeScript code using external libraries or custom code
·       Experience working with external libraries for building interactive data visualizations – Highcharts, D3, or others.
·       Experience developing unit tests for UI using Karma, Protractor and other similar UI testing frameworks
·       Experience building and consuming JSON-based RESTful APIs
·       Experience with relational databases and SQL
·       Experience working with JIRA, GIT, Jenkins, and Confluence
·       Experience working in an Agile team environment. 
·       Experience developing back-end Restful services in Java or .Net.
·       Nice to have experience deploying applications in container based cloud environment
Preference for those with experience in the financial services industry, knowledge of securities processing, accounting data, performance measurement, and/or portfolio risk a plus
  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Senior Specialist Project/Program Manager  (Technology Delivery, Agile, PMO Tools)
column4:
Responsible for the program portfolio management, executive reporting,  governance and oversight of  controls 

 Provide analytics to support business and technology stakeholders at all management levels 

 Leads a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. 

 May allocate/coordinate work within projects.  

 Manages and oversees end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). 

 Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the work structure. 

 Assists in developing detailed project plans and schedules application/infrastructure projects, including goals, risks and resource allocation. 

 Monitors project results for significant deviations. 

 Contributes to vendor and client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. 

 Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. 

 May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. 

 Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. 

 May coordinate resources across organizational boundaries. 

 Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. 

 Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. 

 Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. 

 Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. 
 
 
 
 
 
Sr. Specialist Project/Program Manager->> Leads and provides some direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the Work Structure. Develops detailed project plans and schedules application/infrastructure projects, including goals, risks and resource allocation. Monitors project results for significant deviations. Manages vendor and client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. May coordinate resources across organizational boundaries. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial, 8 - 10 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus.
 


 Prior experience in technology delivery process, managing projects and understanding of Agile 

 Prior experience with PMO tools (Portfolio & Project Management, production bugs, defect tracking, risk, etc.) 

 Prior experience developing analytics, report visualization  and complex excel spreadsheets   For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.Pershing provides critical business process, financial and technology solutions for financial organizations around the globe. 
 
We operate behind the scenes to power transformational change for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, independent financial advisers, hedge fund and '40 Act fund managers and individual investors. 
 
We strive to be innovators, developing open architecture technology and financial solutions to support our customers' growth. We advocate on behalf of our customers and help them respond to regulatory reform and drive positive outcomes for our industry and investors.
 
From our core business as an industry-leading trade execution, clearing and custody provider, we have evolved into a global multifaceted firm that provides investment solutions, forward-thinking technology-driven efficiencies, practice management and service excellence.BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. The job holder provides systems administration, database administration, and application support for mid-range, distributed, imaging processing platforms. S/he performs formulates system scope and objectives, identifies hardware and software requirements, and documents systems activities. S/he is involved in all phases of design, implementation, and production support.
 
Specialist Infrastructure Operations Analyst->> Designs, implements, integrates, and provides full support for software in a multi-tiered, multi-platform environment. Researches the appropriate system software to meet corporate standards and objectives for system performance. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Formulates plans to meet system objectives for the corporation, works in all phases of system analysis, implementation measurement, and reporting. Oversees software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages. Analyzes user hardware and software needs and recommends upgrades or new purchases. Installs, configures, and develops middleware utility programs and related distributed system software on multiple mainframe/distributed hardware/software environments. Leads the middleware team in providing more complex on-site and on-call support through analysis and research. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine platform selection, efficient transaction design, and use. Communicates both formally and informally with customers and end users. Reviews new/modified file transmission requests submitted by all internal business partners at BNY Mellon. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications  
Preferred : 
 
 Minimum 3 - 5 years experience required. Job holder must have working knowledge of mid-range and workstation operating systems; Linux, Windows Server and Windows workstations. Experience providing database administration for Oracle-RAC, MS SQL, and/or Progress is also beneficial as well as experience working within a VMware environment.  S/he must have prior experience with producing detail-level functional requirement documentation and selecting the optimal testing environment for specific applications. S/he must also be experienced with coordinating all parties affected by putting new applications into production. Job holder must be familiar with designing and executing major software installations and key issues related to implementing a secure system.  S/he must be experienced at addressing a variety of technical (hardware, software or application) problems. S/he must also be customer-service oriented, able to build cooperative relationships with people and have effective oral and written communication skills. Job holder must be an experienced problem solver who thinks creatively about solutions and adapts easily to changing priorities. B.S. or B.A. or equivalent work experience required; advanced degree or certification beneficial. 
   
 Operating Systems Administration: (ranked in order of preference) 
 Windows Server 2008/2012/2016 
 Windows 7/10 
 Linux 7 
   
 Database Administration: (ranked in order of preference) 
 MS SQL 2008/2012/2016 
 Oracle 12c 
 Progress 11 
   
 Security Administration: 
 MS Active Directory 
 BladeLogic 
 SCCM 
   
 Additional Skills: 
 VMware, including vSAN 
 Unity VSA 
 Cisco Nexus Switches 
   
 Work Environment: 
 Production support – daylight and off hours on-call 
 Project Implementation – on/off hours/weekends 
 Security patching – on/off hours/weekends 
 
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 6 - 8 years of related infrastructure experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.... BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Sr. Specialist Information Security Analyst - Cyber Security Insider Threat Operations
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, United States; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; New Jersey, United States
column4:
Senior Specialist Information Security Analyst
 
Consults with other IT areas and the businesses and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. 
Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms. Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. 
Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. 
Reviews and analyzes complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations provides direction and guidance on reports and analyses and ensures recommendations are aligned with customer/business needs and capabilities. 
Ensures that all significant security concerns are addressed. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. 
Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
  
 Job Specifications 
 Insider Threat program experience as a focus area within Cybersecurity 
 Researching, triaging, and investigating anomalous events of concern using Behavior Analytical tools, Splunk, and other tools to determine potential indications of malicious or risky insider activity. 
   
 Conducting investigations by analyzing and verifying information through various investigative techniques, internal resources, and Data Loss Prevention controls 
   
 Provides actionable Insider threat intelligence for enterprise risk reduction and remediation by partnering with relevant stakeholders in identifying and driving risk remediation approaches to current and emerging threats 
   
 Collaborate with internal teams and external representatives to drive insider threat program continuous improvement 
   
 Assess and make recommendations to the Insider Threat Services team regarding software tools used to support and improve the insider threat program 
   
 Document Insider Threat gaps and requirements, and activities in written products and reports 
   
 Conducting case and investigative support to investigations, administrative or security inquires, which may include after-hours support and coordination with other teams 
   
 Manage high risk information security incidents by working with internal and other risk teams 
   
 Conducting analysis of known and emerging insider threats 
  Qualifications


Required Experience


 Insider Threat and/or Counterintelligence program experience  

 Experience as an insider threat detection, cyber security, intelligence or counterintelligence analyst with specific understanding of the tactics, techniques and procedures employed by criminal adversaries in relation to insider threats. 

 Exhibits exceptional critical thinking/writing skills - prepares extensive assessments, documents, and disseminates information through reports and briefs to technical and non-technical audiences. 

 Strong cyber analysis experience as it relates to insider threats, experience with data analytics tools and databases 

 Experience writing cybersecurity incident assessment reports 

 Documenting each stage of the investigation and maintaining a focus on case logs and details 

 Presenting findings via written reports and orally to key stakeholders in clear and concise language 

 Ability to interact with and lead discussions with senior Bank executives across different functions and lines of business 

 Skilled in management of high risk regional information security incidents by working in effectively across a multiple teams and partners in a complex organization on a global scale  

 Maintain an awareness of industry challenges and advancements in order to add value to existing technologies and processes used within the team 

 Must be able to operate under tight deadlines and quick learner in applying new tools and techniques 

 Exceptional planning and organizational skills to achieve completion of workload within required timescales 

 Team player must include first class interpersonal skills and high level of Integrity and confidentiality 

 Must possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Cybersecurity or a Bachelor’s Degree in other fields with a minimum of 10+ years in cybersecurity, counterintelligence, or insider threat related fields. 
   


Desired Skills:


 Experience working in Intelligence Community within a counterintelligence and/or insider threat program 

 Hands on experience with investigative and/or insider threat tools, such as UBA, DLP, Computer Forensics, Monitoring, Splunk, Incident Response, Databases, or data visualization tools 

 Experience in financial services industry 

 Understanding and/or working knowledge of insider threats in the Dark and Deepweb and/or Clearnet underground forums 

 Foundational knowledge in conducting complex investigations with an Insider Threat emphasis 

 Certifications- Splunk, CERT, CFE, CFCE, CISSP, GCIH, SANS, GIAC 

 Experience conducting investigative interviews 
 
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. column2: Principal Information Security Analyst – Advanced Cyber Security Visualization
column3:
Multiple Locations:
Palo Alto, California; New Jersey, United States; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; New York, New York
column4:
Principal Information Security Analyst-  
   
 Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure.  
 Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms in diverse system environments.  
 Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies.  
 Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation.  
 Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations.  
 Defines, implements, and applies area-wide security and/or COB policies and standards by leveraging in-depth knowledge of globally accepted information security and/or COB principles.  
 Addresses high risk security concerns or incidents. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  
 
   
   
 
 
 
 This role will be responsible for integrating Cyber Security events and data and use this data to provide visualizations to stake holders. The visualization models will use graph techniques, time series analysis and output from machine learning models. As part of the Cyber Security Analytics team, you will be building advanced dashboards, automated searches utilizing massive amounts of data captured within Splunk and other big data platforms.  
   
 The successful candidate will be part of a high performance Cyber Security Analytics team within the Information Security Division of BNY Mellon. The Cyber Security Analytics team is responsible for providing platforms, analytics and visualization to the Information Security and other functional groups within BNY Mellon with goal of detecting and preventing adversarial attacks.  


 Work with cross functional stakeholders to understand and identify visualization requirements that help BNY Mellon to surface interesting data related to security events and incidents 

 Conduct Proof of Concepts of visualization using Neo4J and other modern platforms 

 Identify and implement platforms required for advanced visualization 

 Build and socialize visualization models with cross functional stake holders 

 Implement relevant machine learning algorithms for visualizing security information 

 Look for innovation and creativity in technology design 

 Deliver quality code within controlled environments using formal release management and continuous integration structures 

 Demonstrates knowledge of financial services and security domain 

 Adapt to a large and diverse program portfolio across multiple locations with a range of integration and analytics technologies     
    Qualifications
Qualifications 
   

Formal education and experience in Visualization Theory and models
Demonstrated experience in developing data loading mechanism within Graph/similar databases
Experience in query languages supported by graph databases
Demonstrated experience in out of the box thinking and implementation of innovative visualization models to provide visibility to security data
Experience in working with cross functional teams to collaborate and socialize visualization rationale, outputs and models and how these help for efficient security and threat monitoring
Previous experience in visualization platforms like Tableau, Qlick, Siren, Keylines etc.
Experience in implementing machine learning models to identify patterns and recommendations
Background in IT Infrastructure ecosystem that  incudes Hybrid and Public Cloud models
Comfortable working with geographically dispersed team
Comfortable with a range of project and software development methodologies – experience with agile scrum preferable
Ability to problem solve and performance tune in a high paced development environment
Exposure to Machine Learning concepts and algorithms is highly preferred
  
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred 10-12 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Business Process Improvement/Best Practice - IC3 Independently analyzes and defines requirements for business process improvement, uses own judgement when determining a plan of action and leads best practices initiatives in the implementation of moderate-sized, full scale projects or portions of large, complex projects. Projects may include analyses of requirements around transitioning businesses from high cost to low cost resource options, modeling of changes across businesses, analysis of location strategy, etc. Works mainly with internal clients, but also assists external clients with moderately complex process changes. Defines the business case for projects and approves proposed business case drafts from more junior team members. Works independently when creating implementation plans and managing redistribution. Effectively monitors the improvement process and addresses issues that arise. Serves as an escalation point for more junior team members. Leads meetings and manages communication with relationship managers, client service managers, regulatory roles, communications roles, business partners, etc. as needed to fulfill improvement plan requirements. Reviews and approves financial-driven analyses of vendors and opportunities to cut underlying costs proposed by more junior managers. Uses past experience to recommend more efficient solutions if necessary. No direct reports. May provide guidance to more junior officers. Manages moderate sized internal and external projects. Bachelors degree required. Graduate degree preferred. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in Operations, Business Analysis or Technology preferred. Qualifications Graduate degree with 5-7 years of exp prefered BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: India-Maharashtra-Pune Job: Information Technology Internal Jobcode: 70253 Organization: Operations & Shared Technology-HR13644 Requisition Number: 1901129

Overview of BNY Mellon:
 
BNY Mellon is a global financial services company passionate about helping clients manage and service their financial assets, operating in 36 countries and serving more than 100 markets. BNY Mellon is a leading provider of financial services for institutions, corporations and high-net-worth individuals, providing superior asset management and wealth management, asset servicing, issuer services, clearing services and treasury services through a worldwide client-focused team. 

Overview of the Team:
 
EMEA AST provides technology services to line-of-business clients including Transfer Agency, Trust & Depository and EMEA Development. These services are provided via a range of vendor product solutions, bespoke developed in house applications, MI and integration components. In addition the function is developing creative business solutions to deliver the ‘next generation’ of financial services harnessing our Digital Ecosystem. 
BNYM are looking for a passionate individual to join their growing EMEA Asset Serving Technology (AST) Development department as a Business Analyst. The EMEA AST Development team is spread globally, you would work closely with Project Managers, Analysts, Developers and Architects based in London, as well as a small development team based in India (Pune and Chennai). 

The team is working towards becoming a fully agile software development team, focusing on delivering often, embracing early feedback from our customers and improving working practice leveraging best in class standards and software toolsets.  

This is a very unique moment to join the team as the whole AST group is going through the major changes both from the location strategy perspective (e.g. growing in Wroclaw / Manchester) but also in terms of shifting the focus towards significantly modernizing the technology stack to leverage some of the benefits provided by company-wide strategic initiatives (Nexen, Greenfield). 
 
Overview of the role:

The successful candidate will be part of a multi skill development team responsible for all phases of the systems integration lifecycle, delivering solutions that add direct value to our large and diverse client base. The team works on a range of applications, delivering changes of various scale and complexity, both on vendor and in house developed software, with legacy as well as new technology components implemented from scratch. Therefore we need a Business Analyst to:


 Liaise with the Business Partners and Developers to deeply understand the existing system functionalities;  

 Analyze, define and challenge the business requirements to come up with the solutions that are fit for purpose, satisfactory for the end-users yet relatively easy to implement by the Development Team;  

 Translate the requirements into precise and comprehensive functional specifications and use-case scenarios;  

 Liaise with Project Manager and Dev Managers to define and prioritize scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for development sprints; 

 Gather and analyze information and developers’ recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas; 

 Apply experiences across various software and/or systems development processes to define and collect metrics and identify as well as implement opportunities for improvement to increase quality of requirements and speed up time-to-market. 


 Qualifications Skills and Experience Requirements: 


 Formal education in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline (or equivalent relevant experience. 

 At least 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in a banking or similar environment  
Required Skills:

Experience with building solutions based on business and technology requirements
Understanding of service orientated multi-tiered application architecture utilizing web service standards and protocols (REST, JSON)
Excellent collaboration skills
Comfortable with a range of project and software development methodologies – experience with agile scrum preferable
Ability to problem solve in a high paced development environment.
Familiar with data models
Understanding of Cloud Infrastructure What we can offer you:Full time contract of employmentCompetitive salaryHealth & Life InsuranceMultisport card / Cinema Tickets / Nursery subsidiaryPension schemeExcellent opportunities for training, growth and professional developmentOpportunities to engage in diverse projects due to growth of business migrationsA multitude of opportunities to get involved in additional charity projectsA collaborative culture and great teams

Specialist Infrastructure Operations Analyst->> Designs, implements, integrates, and provides full support for software in a multi-tiered, multi-platform environment. Researches the appropriate system software to meet corporate standards and objectives for system performance. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Formulates plans to meet system objectives for the corporation, works in all phases of system analysis, implementation measurement, and reporting. Oversees software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages. Analyzes user hardware and software needs and recommends upgrades or new purchases. Installs, configures, and develops middleware utility programs and related distributed system software on multiple mainframe/distributed hardware/software environments. Leads the middleware team in providing more complex on-site and on-call support through analysis and research. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine platform selection, efficient transaction design, and use. Communicates both formally and informally with customers and end users. Reviews new/modified file transmission requests submitted by all internal business partners at BNY Mellon. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications  
Preferred : 
 
 Minimum 3 - 5 years experience required. Job holder must have working knowledge of mid-range and workstation operating systems; Linux, Windows Server and Windows workstations. Experience providing database administration for Oracle-RAC, MS SQL, and/or Progress is also beneficial as well as experience working within a VMware environment.  S/he must have prior experience with producing detail-level functional requirement documentation and selecting the optimal testing environment for specific applications. S/he must also be experienced with coordinating all parties affected by putting new applications into production. Job holder must be familiar with designing and executing major software installations and key issues related to implementing a secure system.  S/he must be experienced at addressing a variety of technical (hardware, software or application) problems. S/he must also be customer-service oriented, able to build cooperative relationships with people and have effective oral and written communication skills. Job holder must be an experienced problem solver who thinks creatively about solutions and adapts easily to changing priorities. B.S. or B.A. or equivalent work experience required; advanced degree or certification beneficial.

 Windows Server 2008/2012/2016 
 Windows 7/10 
 Linux 7

column2: Sr. Specialist Information Security Analyst - Cyber Security Insider Threat Operations
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, United States; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; New Jersey, United States
column4:
Senior Specialist Information Security Analyst
 
Consults with other IT areas and the businesses and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. 
Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms. Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. 
Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. 
Reviews and analyzes complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations provides direction and guidance on reports and analyses and ensures recommendations are aligned with customer/business needs and capabilities. 
Ensures that all significant security concerns are addressed. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. 
Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
  
 Job Specifications 
 Insider Threat program experience as a focus area within Cybersecurity 
 Researching, triaging, and investigating anomalous events of concern using Behavior Analytical tools, Splunk, and other tools to determine potential indications of malicious or risky insider activity. 
   
 Conducting investigations by analyzing and verifying information through various investigative techniques, internal resources, and Data Loss Prevention controls 
   
 Provides actionable Insider threat intelligence for enterprise risk reduction and remediation by partnering with relevant stakeholders in identifying and driving risk remediation approaches to current and emerging threats 
   
 Collaborate with internal teams and external representatives to drive insider threat program continuous improvement 
   
 Assess and make recommendations to the Insider Threat Services team regarding software tools used to support and improve the insider threat program 
   
 Document Insider Threat gaps and requirements, and activities in written products and reports 
   
 Conducting case and investigative support to investigations, administrative or security inquires, which may include after-hours support and coordination with other teams 
   
 Manage high risk information security incidents by working with internal and other risk teams 
   
 Conducting analysis of known and emerging insider threats 
  Qualifications


Required Experience


 Insider Threat and/or Counterintelligence program experience  

 Experience as an insider threat detection, cyber security, intelligence or counterintelligence analyst with specific understanding of the tactics, techniques and procedures employed by criminal adversaries in relation to insider threats. 

 Exhibits exceptional critical thinking/writing skills - prepares extensive assessments, documents, and disseminates information through reports and briefs to technical and non-technical audiences. 

 Strong cyber analysis experience as it relates to insider threats, experience with data analytics tools and databases 

 Experience writing cybersecurity incident assessment reports 

 Documenting each stage of the investigation and maintaining a focus on case logs and details 

 Presenting findings via written reports and orally to key stakeholders in clear and concise language 

 Ability to interact with and lead discussions with senior Bank executives across different functions and lines of business 

 Skilled in management of high risk regional information security incidents by working in effectively across a multiple teams and partners in a complex organization on a global scale  

 Maintain an awareness of industry challenges and advancements in order to add value to existing technologies and processes used within the team 

 Must be able to operate under tight deadlines and quick learner in applying new tools and techniques 

 Exceptional planning and organizational skills to achieve completion of workload within required timescales 

 Team player must include first class interpersonal skills and high level of Integrity and confidentiality 

 Must possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Cybersecurity or a Bachelor’s Degree in other fields with a minimum of 10+ years in cybersecurity, counterintelligence, or insider threat related fields. 
   


Desired Skills:


 Experience working in Intelligence Community within a counterintelligence and/or insider threat program 

 Hands on experience with investigative and/or insider threat tools, such as UBA, DLP, Computer Forensics, Monitoring, Splunk, Incident Response, Databases, or data visualization tools 

 Experience in financial services industry 

 Understanding and/or working knowledge of insider threats in the Dark and Deepweb and/or Clearnet underground forums 

 Foundational knowledge in conducting complex investigations with an Insider Threat emphasis 

 Certifications- Splunk, CERT, CFE, CFCE, CISSP, GCIH, SANS, GIAC 

 Experience conducting investigative interviews 
 
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
