column2: Principal Information Security Analyst – Advanced Cyber Security Visualization
column3:
Multiple Locations:
Palo Alto, California; New Jersey, United States; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; New York, New York
column4:
Principal Information Security Analyst-  
   
 Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure.  
 Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms in diverse system environments.  
 Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies.  
 Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation.  
 Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations.  
 Defines, implements, and applies area-wide security and/or COB policies and standards by leveraging in-depth knowledge of globally accepted information security and/or COB principles.  
 Addresses high risk security concerns or incidents. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  
 
   
   
 
 
 
 This role will be responsible for integrating Cyber Security events and data and use this data to provide visualizations to stake holders. The visualization models will use graph techniques, time series analysis and output from machine learning models. As part of the Cyber Security Analytics team, you will be building advanced dashboards, automated searches utilizing massive amounts of data captured within Splunk and other big data platforms.  
   
 The successful candidate will be part of a high performance Cyber Security Analytics team within the Information Security Division of BNY Mellon. The Cyber Security Analytics team is responsible for providing platforms, analytics and visualization to the Information Security and other functional groups within BNY Mellon with goal of detecting and preventing adversarial attacks.  


 Work with cross functional stakeholders to understand and identify visualization requirements that help BNY Mellon to surface interesting data related to security events and incidents 

 Conduct Proof of Concepts of visualization using Neo4J and other modern platforms 

 Identify and implement platforms required for advanced visualization 

 Build and socialize visualization models with cross functional stake holders 

 Implement relevant machine learning algorithms for visualizing security information 

 Look for innovation and creativity in technology design 

 Deliver quality code within controlled environments using formal release management and continuous integration structures 

 Demonstrates knowledge of financial services and security domain 

 Adapt to a large and diverse program portfolio across multiple locations with a range of integration and analytics technologies     
    Qualifications
Qualifications 
   

Formal education and experience in Visualization Theory and models
Demonstrated experience in developing data loading mechanism within Graph/similar databases
Experience in query languages supported by graph databases
Demonstrated experience in out of the box thinking and implementation of innovative visualization models to provide visibility to security data
Experience in working with cross functional teams to collaborate and socialize visualization rationale, outputs and models and how these help for efficient security and threat monitoring
Previous experience in visualization platforms like Tableau, Qlick, Siren, Keylines etc.
Experience in implementing machine learning models to identify patterns and recommendations
Background in IT Infrastructure ecosystem that  incudes Hybrid and Public Cloud models
Comfortable working with geographically dispersed team
Comfortable with a range of project and software development methodologies – experience with agile scrum preferable
Ability to problem solve and performance tune in a high paced development environment
Exposure to Machine Learning concepts and algorithms is highly preferred
  
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred 10-12 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Business Process Improvement/Best Practice - IC3 Independently analyzes and defines requirements for business process improvement, uses own judgement when determining a plan of action and leads best practices initiatives in the implementation of moderate-sized, full scale projects or portions of large, complex projects. Projects may include analyses of requirements around transitioning businesses from high cost to low cost resource options, modeling of changes across businesses, analysis of location strategy, etc. Works mainly with internal clients, but also assists external clients with moderately complex process changes. Defines the business case for projects and approves proposed business case drafts from more junior team members. Works independently when creating implementation plans and managing redistribution. Effectively monitors the improvement process and addresses issues that arise. Serves as an escalation point for more junior team members. Leads meetings and manages communication with relationship managers, client service managers, regulatory roles, communications roles, business partners, etc. as needed to fulfill improvement plan requirements. Reviews and approves financial-driven analyses of vendors and opportunities to cut underlying costs proposed by more junior managers. Uses past experience to recommend more efficient solutions if necessary. No direct reports. May provide guidance to more junior officers. Manages moderate sized internal and external projects. Bachelors degree required. Graduate degree preferred. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in Operations, Business Analysis or Technology preferred. Qualifications Graduate degree with 5-7 years of exp prefered BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: India-Maharashtra-Pune Job: Information Technology Internal Jobcode: 70253 Organization: Operations & Shared Technology-HR13644 Requisition Number: 1901129

Overview of BNY Mellon:
 
BNY Mellon is a global financial services company passionate about helping clients manage and service their financial assets, operating in 36 countries and serving more than 100 markets. BNY Mellon is a leading provider of financial services for institutions, corporations and high-net-worth individuals, providing superior asset management and wealth management, asset servicing, issuer services, clearing services and treasury services through a worldwide client-focused team. 

Overview of the Team:
 
EMEA AST provides technology services to line-of-business clients including Transfer Agency, Trust & Depository and EMEA Development. These services are provided via a range of vendor product solutions, bespoke developed in house applications, MI and integration components. In addition the function is developing creative business solutions to deliver the ‘next generation’ of financial services harnessing our Digital Ecosystem. 
BNYM are looking for a passionate individual to join their growing EMEA Asset Serving Technology (AST) Development department as a Business Analyst. The EMEA AST Development team is spread globally, you would work closely with Project Managers, Analysts, Developers and Architects based in London, as well as a small development team based in India (Pune and Chennai). 

The team is working towards becoming a fully agile software development team, focusing on delivering often, embracing early feedback from our customers and improving working practice leveraging best in class standards and software toolsets.  

This is a very unique moment to join the team as the whole AST group is going through the major changes both from the location strategy perspective (e.g. growing in Wroclaw / Manchester) but also in terms of shifting the focus towards significantly modernizing the technology stack to leverage some of the benefits provided by company-wide strategic initiatives (Nexen, Greenfield). 
 
Overview of the role:

The successful candidate will be part of a multi skill development team responsible for all phases of the systems integration lifecycle, delivering solutions that add direct value to our large and diverse client base. The team works on a range of applications, delivering changes of various scale and complexity, both on vendor and in house developed software, with legacy as well as new technology components implemented from scratch. Therefore we need a Business Analyst to:


 Liaise with the Business Partners and Developers to deeply understand the existing system functionalities;  

 Analyze, define and challenge the business requirements to come up with the solutions that are fit for purpose, satisfactory for the end-users yet relatively easy to implement by the Development Team;  

 Translate the requirements into precise and comprehensive functional specifications and use-case scenarios;  

 Liaise with Project Manager and Dev Managers to define and prioritize scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for development sprints; 

 Gather and analyze information and developers’ recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas; 

 Apply experiences across various software and/or systems development processes to define and collect metrics and identify as well as implement opportunities for improvement to increase quality of requirements and speed up time-to-market. 


 Qualifications Skills and Experience Requirements: 


 Formal education in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline (or equivalent relevant experience. 

 At least 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in a banking or similar environment  
Required Skills:

Experience with building solutions based on business and technology requirements
Understanding of service orientated multi-tiered application architecture utilizing web service standards and protocols (REST, JSON)
Excellent collaboration skills
Comfortable with a range of project and software development methodologies – experience with agile scrum preferable
Ability to problem solve in a high paced development environment.
Familiar with data models
Understanding of Cloud Infrastructure What we can offer you:Full time contract of employmentCompetitive salaryHealth & Life InsuranceMultisport card / Cinema Tickets / Nursery subsidiaryPension schemeExcellent opportunities for training, growth and professional developmentOpportunities to engage in diverse projects due to growth of business migrationsA multitude of opportunities to get involved in additional charity projectsA collaborative culture and great teams

column2: Specialist Information Security Analyst - Technical Cyber Risk Assessment
column3:
Multiple Locations:
Florham Park, New Jersey; New York, New York; Washington, District of Columbia; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
column4:
This is a highly visible position responsible for leading and assisting in cyber assessments on internal affiliates and third-parties based on the BNYM Cybersecurity Services Model (CSM).  Assessments measure compliance with the CSM and identify and quantify any gaps.  The assessor is responsible for meeting and interacting with the entities being assessed, conducting the assessments, producing and reviewing assessment artifacts, reviewing remediation plans, and tracking the lifecycle of gaps through closure. Employees in the position will have the opportunity to work across all lines of business within the organization, with exposure to a wide breath of technologies as they are integrated within the organizations via 3rd party vendors and affiliates. You will be partnering with groups and affiliates throughout the organization to provide meaningful risk assessment for new technologies as they are integrated within the bank.  
 Responsibilities


 Execute and support cyber security risk assessments on BNYM affiliates or third-parties 

 Validate effectiveness of current controls and identify potential gaps 

 Review assessment results for vulnerabilities, gaps, and control deficiencies and work with business stakeholders to establish plans for sustainable resolution 

 Document results of assessments and verification activities 

 Perform engineering review of security control modification proposals and determine the effectiveness of the proposals while determining their ability to meet BNYM standards 

 Partner with BNY Mellon business units and affiliates to create technical solutions based on risk assessments 

 Ability to speak and understand terminology, especially those related to cybersecurity assurance 

 Produce and maintain metrics based on the assessment framework 

 Determine potential impact of detected gaps and translate that into risk within the established framework 

 Develop situational awareness and stay informed of current technology and vulnerabilities 

 Perform any tasks to ensure that the Cyber Assessment Team meets its commitments 
 
    Qualifications 

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 6-8 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Cybersecurity related experience in enterprise architecture or engineering

Working knowledge of security domains, auditing standards and frameworks, and risk analysis frameworks including ISO 27001, NIST Cyber Security Framework, IT-CMF, etc.

Knowledge of domestic and international regulatory requirements as a plus

One or more of the following certifications required; CISSP, CRISC, CISA

Any other security related certification considered a plus (CEH, Security+, etc.)

A broad and diverse security skill-set with advanced understanding of both technical and non-technical controls and the ability to effectively apply this knowledge when performing assessments

A minimum base knowledge of networking components and various operating systems and cloud environments
Ability to identify, assesses and document the severity and potential impact of risks and communicate risk assessment findings to risk owners in a way that consistently drives objective, fact-based decisions
Strong decision-making capabilities, with a proven ability to weigh the relative costs and benefits of potential actions and identify the most appropriate actions
Ability to understand and communicate the business needs and a commitment to delivering high-quality, prompt, and efficient service to the business

Treasury Services Technology is proud to offer a rewarding opportunity for an experienced OFAC and AML professional.  The candidate will be a significant contributor to a globally diverse team which is responsible for enhancing and maintaining our Fircosoft OFAC sanction screening application.  This software is used to perform real-time sanction screening of financial messages at BNYM.  Challenges will include OFAC screening of financial messages, testing coordinating, and deploying product enhancements, building new utilities and reports, onboarding new financial applications, and coordinating meetings with business partners and vendors.  This highly visible application is critical for the continued success of the company’s regulatory and compliance driven initiatives. 
   
 Sr. Specialist Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs.  Experience with Accuity, LexisNexis, and Actimize products is a plus 
Understanding of networking and system architecture
Development experience in a fast-paced financial or securities environment
Experience with Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Oracle RAC, and MQ Messaging

SWIFT Messaging experience is preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor's degree, preferably in IT or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus
Agile / Scrum and continuous integration / delivery experience is preferred

 Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Principal Information Security Analyst-  
   
 Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure.

 Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies.

 Cyber Security Analytics Engineer->> Designs, Develops and Implements Security Analytics that covers multiple functional areas within the organization. Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies that are part of organization’s infrastructure and application ecosystem. Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations.  
   
 
 
 Sr. Security Engineer – Next Generation Threat Detection and Analytics 
 Location: Palo Alto, CA, Pittsburgh, PA or Florham Park, NJ or New York, NY 
 The Threat Detection Team at BNY Mellon develops and maintains the signals, tools, and infrastructure required to We deep analysis of threats on our corporate environment.  
 This role will be responsible for identifying and constantly evolving techniques to match sophisticated attacks.  
   
 As part of this team, you will be building advanced and novel detection mechanisms for attacker techniques tactics and procedures, developing systems to automate remediation, conducting threat hunting, and performing network and systems forensics, as well as malware and indicator analysis. 
   
 The successful candidate will be part of a high performance Cyber Security Analytics team within the Information Security Division of BNY Mellon.  
   
 The Cyber Security Analytics team is responsible for providing platforms, analytics and visualization to the Information Security and other functional groups within BNY Mellon with goal of detecting and preventing adversarial attacks.  


 Responsible for understanding the Cyber Security Threat Landscape and applying innovative solutions to address threats using analytics  

 Responsible for identifying Treat Detection Use cases in modern workload ecosystem and implementing the techniques to surface these threats 

 Build analytics that can be applied to the discovery and tracking of advanced adversaries 

 Assess N-Cloud Data Center Architecture (traditional, hybrid and public cloud ) for Security Attack Surface , identify the data sources , logs and events necessary to analyze insider and outsider threats 

 Look for innovation and creativity in technology design 

 Deliver quality code within controlled environments using formal release management and continuous integration structures 

 Keep up to date with current trends, tactics, and vulnerabilities in the security space 

 Demonstrates knowledge of financial services and security domain Adapt to a large and diverse program portfolio across multiple locations with a range of integration and analytics technologies   
    Qualifications
Qualifications 
   

Experience and understanding of modern workloads ecosystem, including, SD-WAN, Software and Host based Firewalls, Hybrid Cloud, Public Cloud – Azure and AWS IaaS, Containers, Micro Services, CI/CDD pipeline
Demonstrated experience in out of the box thinking and implementation of innovative threat detection techniques using Splunk and/or other platforms
Experience in working with cross functional teams to collaborate and socialize threat detection techniques and results
Solid understanding of MITRE and/or similar threat  frameworks
Experience in Threat Detection
Comfortable working with geographically dispersed team
Comfortable with a range of project and software development methodologies – experience with agile scrum preferable
Ability to problem solve and performance tune in a high paced development environment
Exposure to Machine Learning concepts and algorithms is highly preferred

Sr. Technical Specialist Appl Support Analyst – 3rd party Governance
Within the Asset Servicing division, as a Third Party Governance engagement manager, you are responsible for the oversight of division’s vendor based applications.  This includes vendor hosted or vendor licensed software operated in-house within the bank’s data centers.
This position requires a technology project manager who is self-directed, can manage vendor and in-house relationships to bridge communications, coordination and oversee a vendor’s operation of their service or the quality of software delivered to the bank.   
 
The successful candidate will be part of the highly visible team driving third party enhanced governance of applications and technology services within Asset Servicing Technology.  This requires strong knowledge in platform architectures and technology operations coupled to third party governance.
Project management for technology based projects/efforts, a demonstrated ability to be organized, prioritize and multitask activities is important.  This is a highly visible role in a high performing team within the bank, as such you will need to be a collaborative team player, working with your peers throughout the technology and operations areas as needed as part of a global organization. This role will require some out of hours and weekend work.  
 
Description:
• Accountable for the managing projects for vendor based applications managed by the team.  
• As part of the TPG team oversee that vendor related and activities meets banks expectations and standards/policies and address shortcomings
• Identify gaps between the current state and target model for the application and support model
• Applies effective project management methodologies and control techniques. 
• Helps drive vendor based projects and initiatives forward, focusing on resiliency/recoverability of the application and/or service
For vendor hosted services, when production incidents are escalated to AST Vendor Governance, engage with the application manager/service owner and vendor to help drive resolution and remediation to prevent re-occurrence.
 
  Qualifications       Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, Advanced degree is beneficial, 8-10years  of diverse experience in multiple areas of information 
       Experience with vendor hosted solutions (Cloud, SAAS/ASP) as well as vendor software that resides on in-house servers
·        Experience communicating, verbal and written, with all levels of the organization, from technical to Snr Mgmt.
·        Experience with change, incident (production support) and problem management processes 
·        Experience with global applications that support global user base, high transaction volumes
·        Experience with managing changes to applications and their environments. 
·        Experienced in project management and being well organized
Preferred (Internal/External):
·        Extensive experience in managing vendor based services within an asset servicing organization
·        Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus

column2: Principal Information Security Analyst - Senior Splunk Engineer
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, New York; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Florham Park, New Jersey
column4:
Principal Information Security Analyst-
 
Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. 
Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms in diverse system environments. 
Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. 
Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. 
Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations. 
Defines, implements, and applies area-wide security and/or COB policies and standards by leveraging in-depth knowledge of globally accepted information security and/or COB principles. 
Addresses high risk security concerns or incidents. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
 
Position Overview 
 This is a  Sr. Splunk Threat Hunter/Playbook Engineer role which will be an integral part of the dynamic, fast-paced Threat Detection team within CyberSecurity Analytics.  
 A successful candidate will bring a positive, passionate attitude to the team's playbook and threat hunting initiatives by leveraging rich threat-hunting and specialized Splunk-related experience.  
 As an expert in Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL), you'll be relied on to work closely with customer delivery managers, prioritize daily tasks, develop/deploy/verify advanced threat-hunting playbooks based on indicators of compromise and network anomaly detections, alerting logic, and enhance the organization's overall playbook strategy and threat analytics.  
   
 Key responsibilities and deliverables
  

Day to day management of playbook content lifecycles including customer interactions and priority, content creation, testing & tuning, version/value documentation, and finally, user-acceptance testing and effectiveness analytics.
Utilize Git repositories to store, comment, and version on playbooks with Threat Detection customers including the Security Operations Center, Insider Threat, and SIEM Engineering among other teams.
Participate in war-gaming and tabletop activities as part of red/blue team exercise to strengthen and test playbook health, maturity, and relevant documentation.
Collaborate with Threat Detection team members to take lead on the design of complex SPL queries to advance searching, threat hunting, reports, dashboards, as well as Threat Detection team analytics/metrics.
Collaborate closely with CSA members on the design of functional, process-oriented Splunk knowledge objects such as recurring reporting, searches, Splunk datamodels, macros, lookups, tags, and dashboards to combat threats and advance objectives within CyberSecurity Analytics.
Collaborate with SIEM Engineering to ensure gaps are identified in onboarded data, CIM normalization, and correlation queries to ensure playbooks are able to be run at optimal health.
Collaborate with SOC members, Threat Detection delivery managers, and other stakeholders to ensure customer issues and priorities are engaged via playbook work pipeline; ensure playbook processes are continually maturing including triage, escalation, incident, and change management.
Engage in ongoing research in security tools, techniques, and procedures, as well as advance Threat Detection initiatives based on aggressive security principals, machine learning algorithms, and threat mitigation techniques.
Ownership to reproduce, respond, document, and improve reported playbook issues as reported by Threat Detection teammates or customers.
Proactively collaborate with Threat Detection teammates and members throughout the greater CyberSecurity Analytics organization to document actions, hurdles, and blockers with regard to work pipeline and progress. Qualifications
Qualifications

Expert-level demonstrative understanding of Splunk technologies include Core, Enterprise Security, User Behavior Analytics (UBA) and the Machine Learning Toolkit (Splunk ML), as well as Advanced Threat Analytics.
Demonstrable experience with SPL creation, Splunk knowledge object management, Splunkbase, TAs, Dashboard Design
Significant experience with network protocols, security orchestration, security/perimeter devices.
Experience with Splunk data ingestion throughout the entire onboarding cycle, from data discovery to ingestion, CIMification, and onboarding validation; including JSON, XML, syslog, UF/HF.
Active listening and collaborative skills with various audiences, including direct team members, security team and Splunk engineers, and executive stakeholders, in order to craft Splunk and search development solutions
Experience with scripting languages to automate repetitive analysis and tasks.
Advanced knowledge of specific scripting tools including Regex, Python, Javascript, and similar.
Experience with open-source security tools including Wireshark, nmap, burp, Snort, and Kali.
Demonstrable competency with InfoSec fundamentals including Lockheed Killchain and MITRE ATT&CK-based analytics
Experience with threat intelligence standards such as STIX, TAXII, and CybOX
Demonstrable Threat Hunting experience
Demonstrable Incident Response Workflow experience
Fundamental understanding of InfoSec threat sharing including IoCs, artifacts, and forensic techniques
Exceptional problem solving capabilities and strong documentation, communication skills both verbal and non-verbal
Ability to self-manage workload and goals independently in a fact-paced, multi-threaded, and deadline-driven organization
Passion for communication and attention to detail, research, and articulate, value-driven reporting
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, including high-quality visual presentation of data within PowerPoint and Visio
 
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred 10-12 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. column2: Sr.Technical Specialist Application Support Analyst – 3rd party Governance
column3:
Multiple Locations:

column4:
Sr. Technical Specialist Appl Support Analyst – 3rd party Governance
Within the Asset Servicing division, as a Third Party Governance engagement manager, you are responsible for the oversight of division’s vendor based applications.  This includes vendor hosted or vendor licensed software operated in-house within the bank’s data centers.
This position requires a technology project manager who is self-directed, can manage vendor and in-house relationships to bridge communications, coordination and oversee a vendor’s operation of their service or the quality of software delivered to the bank.   
 
The successful candidate will be part of the highly visible team driving third party enhanced governance of applications and technology services within Asset Servicing Technology.  This requires strong knowledge in platform architectures and technology operations coupled to third party governance.
Project management for technology based projects/efforts, a demonstrated ability to be organized, prioritize and multitask activities is important.  This is a highly visible role in a high performing team within the bank, as such you will need to be a collaborative team player, working with your peers throughout the technology and operations areas as needed as part of a global organization. This role will require some out of hours and weekend work.  
 
Description:
• Accountable for the managing projects for vendor based applications managed by the team.  
• As part of the TPG team oversee that vendor related and activities meets banks expectations and standards/policies and address shortcomings
• Identify gaps between the current state and target model for the application and support model
• Applies effective project management methodologies and control techniques. 
• Helps drive vendor based projects and initiatives forward, focusing on resiliency/recoverability of the application and/or service
For vendor hosted services, when production incidents are escalated to AST Vendor Governance, engage with the application manager/service owner and vendor to help drive resolution and remediation to prevent re-occurrence.
 
  Qualifications       Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, Advanced degree is beneficial, 8-10years  of diverse experience in multiple areas of information 
       Experience with vendor hosted solutions (Cloud, SAAS/ASP) as well as vendor software that resides on in-house servers
·        Experience communicating, verbal and written, with all levels of the organization, from technical to Snr Mgmt.
·        Experience with change, incident (production support) and problem management processes 
·        Experience with global applications that support global user base, high transaction volumes
·        Experience with managing changes to applications and their environments. 
·        Experienced in project management and being well organized
Preferred (Internal/External):
·        Extensive experience in managing vendor based services within an asset servicing organization
·        Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus

Principal Information Security Analyst-  
   
 Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure.  
 Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms in diverse system environments.  
 Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies.

Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies that are part of organization’s infrastructure and application ecosystem. Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations.

The Cyber Security Analytics team is responsible for providing platforms, analytics and visualization to the Information Security and other functional groups within BNY Mellon with goal of detecting and preventing adversarial attacks.

 Design and Develop necessary Data Integrations to pull/push data into /out of Security Analytics Platforms 

 Look for innovation and creativity in technology design 

 Deliver quality code within controlled environments using formal release management and continuous integration structures 

 Keep up to date with current trends, tactics, and vulnerabilities in the security space 

 Demonstrates knowledge of financial services and security domain 

 Adapt to a large and diverse program portfolio across multiple locations with a range of integration and analytics technologies

column2: Principal Information Security Analyst - Senior Splunk Engineer
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, New York; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Florham Park, New Jersey
column4:
Principal Information Security Analyst-
 
Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. 
Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms in diverse system environments. 
Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. 
Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. 
Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations. 
Defines, implements, and applies area-wide security and/or COB policies and standards by leveraging in-depth knowledge of globally accepted information security and/or COB principles. 
Addresses high risk security concerns or incidents. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
 
Position Overview 
 This is a  Sr. Splunk Threat Hunter/Playbook Engineer role which will be an integral part of the dynamic, fast-paced Threat Detection team within CyberSecurity Analytics.  
 A successful candidate will bring a positive, passionate attitude to the team's playbook and threat hunting initiatives by leveraging rich threat-hunting and specialized Splunk-related experience.  
 As an expert in Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL), you'll be relied on to work closely with customer delivery managers, prioritize daily tasks, develop/deploy/verify advanced threat-hunting playbooks based on indicators of compromise and network anomaly detections, alerting logic, and enhance the organization's overall playbook strategy and threat analytics.  
   
 Key responsibilities and deliverables
  

Day to day management of playbook content lifecycles including customer interactions and priority, content creation, testing & tuning, version/value documentation, and finally, user-acceptance testing and effectiveness analytics.
Utilize Git repositories to store, comment, and version on playbooks with Threat Detection customers including the Security Operations Center, Insider Threat, and SIEM Engineering among other teams.
Participate in war-gaming and tabletop activities as part of red/blue team exercise to strengthen and test playbook health, maturity, and relevant documentation.
Collaborate with Threat Detection team members to take lead on the design of complex SPL queries to advance searching, threat hunting, reports, dashboards, as well as Threat Detection team analytics/metrics.
Collaborate closely with CSA members on the design of functional, process-oriented Splunk knowledge objects such as recurring reporting, searches, Splunk datamodels, macros, lookups, tags, and dashboards to combat threats and advance objectives within CyberSecurity Analytics.
Collaborate with SIEM Engineering to ensure gaps are identified in onboarded data, CIM normalization, and correlation queries to ensure playbooks are able to be run at optimal health.
Collaborate with SOC members, Threat Detection delivery managers, and other stakeholders to ensure customer issues and priorities are engaged via playbook work pipeline; ensure playbook processes are continually maturing including triage, escalation, incident, and change management.
Engage in ongoing research in security tools, techniques, and procedures, as well as advance Threat Detection initiatives based on aggressive security principals, machine learning algorithms, and threat mitigation techniques.
Ownership to reproduce, respond, document, and improve reported playbook issues as reported by Threat Detection teammates or customers.
Proactively collaborate with Threat Detection teammates and members throughout the greater CyberSecurity Analytics organization to document actions, hurdles, and blockers with regard to work pipeline and progress. Qualifications
Qualifications

Expert-level demonstrative understanding of Splunk technologies include Core, Enterprise Security, User Behavior Analytics (UBA) and the Machine Learning Toolkit (Splunk ML), as well as Advanced Threat Analytics.
Demonstrable experience with SPL creation, Splunk knowledge object management, Splunkbase, TAs, Dashboard Design
Significant experience with network protocols, security orchestration, security/perimeter devices.
Experience with Splunk data ingestion throughout the entire onboarding cycle, from data discovery to ingestion, CIMification, and onboarding validation; including JSON, XML, syslog, UF/HF.
Active listening and collaborative skills with various audiences, including direct team members, security team and Splunk engineers, and executive stakeholders, in order to craft Splunk and search development solutions
Experience with scripting languages to automate repetitive analysis and tasks.
Advanced knowledge of specific scripting tools including Regex, Python, Javascript, and similar.
Experience with open-source security tools including Wireshark, nmap, burp, Snort, and Kali.
Demonstrable competency with InfoSec fundamentals including Lockheed Killchain and MITRE ATT&CK-based analytics
Experience with threat intelligence standards such as STIX, TAXII, and CybOX
Demonstrable Threat Hunting experience
Demonstrable Incident Response Workflow experience
Fundamental understanding of InfoSec threat sharing including IoCs, artifacts, and forensic techniques
Exceptional problem solving capabilities and strong documentation, communication skills both verbal and non-verbal
Ability to self-manage workload and goals independently in a fact-paced, multi-threaded, and deadline-driven organization
Passion for communication and attention to detail, research, and articulate, value-driven reporting
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, including high-quality visual presentation of data within PowerPoint and Visio
 
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred 10-12 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. The Pershing Technology group has an opening for a Mainframe (z/OS) Database Administrator (DBA) with experience in DB2 relational database management system to support our operational transactional financial application systems. The DB2 DBA will be a member of the technology team working on application database projects and requested development and production support services. 
   
 The qualified candidate will work closely with application development teams to design and maintain database environments, perform database object creation and migrations, perform DB2 data refreshes to support application testing, SQL performance and tuning.Individual will be required to provide 24/7 DBA coverage on a rotating basis, support production migrations and disaster recovery exercises. Candidate should have experience with performing database Backups, Recoveries, Reorgs, Unloads, Loads, and a good understanding of COBOL program packages and plans within DB2 and Stored Procedure development.  
   
 Sr. Specialist Database Analyst->> Designs, implements, and supports database management structures, as well as database back-up, recovery, security, archiving and conversion strategies. Collaborates with application development teams on various database issues and takes a lead role in problem resolution. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine database/system platform selection, efficient database design, and access. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation.

 • Research into new, emerging and cutting edge technology (eg - Angular, MongoDB, Mobile App Development)

Principal Project/Program Manager    Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have formal management responsibility for Program Team members. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus.  Qualifications Contributes to the achievement of area objectives Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. column2: Agile Champion - Organizational Change Agent (Principal Process Improvement Analyst)
column4:
Organizational Summary: Pershing Technology provides our business partners with client-focused, technology-based solutions. These enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions and leading-edge infrastructure. Pershing Technology provides employees with the tools and resources required to improve efficiency and productivity. Description: Lead the implementation/ adoption of Agile/Lean principles as the enhanced solution delivery methodology across the business and technology divisions. Provide expertise and leadership by helping teams adopt Agile methods and mindset to promote Agile transformation. Drive continuous process improvement through reviewing existing processes and recommending improvements or introducing new methodologies as appropriate. Identifies and provides guidance about new methodologies, tools, processes, and deliverables. Ensure process compliance by conducting process quality control. Responsibilities: •Lead process Improvement efforts and proactively manage all aspects of advancing the state of software delivery practices to ensure the processes and methods provide the appropriate balance of effectiveness and efficiency for the organization. •Function as the organizational change agent for all process improvement initiatives. Manage all process improvement initiatives roll-out including training the appropriate stakeholders and users base. •Drive enterprise agile implementation/ adoption. Develop and implement an agile framework including a comprehensive implementation plan within an aggressive timeframe. Function as an organizational change agent/ champion required for the agile transformation. Provide training and coaching on agile practices and principles including Kanban. Develop processes, tools as well as define roles and responsibilities appropriate for specific programs using the agile framework. Coach teams on product/feature planning, daily standups, retrospectives, release planning and other agile activities. Guide business owners and SME’s in backlog creation and refinement •Manage team responsible for conducting periodic internal reviews or audits to ensure process compliance of the defined software delivery processes and procedures. Work with stakeholders to remediate and close gaps for all non-compliance items. Ensure readiness for enterprise audits by external auditors. •Manage the solution delivery enterprise tool (HP-PPM). Oversee all tool enhancements required to accommodate process and reporting changes. Prioritize and oversee product backlog and sprints. •Conduct informal appraisals to assess gaps in the software delivery processes. May conduct formal appraisals in accordance with applicable standards (ex. CBA-IPI) •Facilitate communication of all process related information to all impacted stakeholders. Improve transparency across technology and business stakeholders. Principal Process Improvement Analyst->> Leads and provides innovative direction and guidance for a wide array of activities supporting the improvement of processes and procedures. Provides project/process management consulting, coaching, and training to IT teams and/or Project/Process Office staff across multiple LOBs and/or the enterprise. Assists in setting the direction on approaches/tools to build, streamline, implement, and/or automate key processes. Champions the company's project management methodology, tools and techniques. Leads formal appraisals to assess gaps in the processes used within multiple LOBs, as well as appraisals in accordance with applicable standards (e.g. CBA-IPI or SCE) for LOBs other than his/her own. Counsels one or more LOBs regarding their formal and informal assessments and checkpoints. Develops and manages project plans to support strategic process improvement or IT projects at the LOB or enterprise level. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. May manage enterprise-wide IT processes and work flows which maximize efficiency, and comply with regulatory and audit requirements. Manages and develops strategic client partnerships to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives, Qualifications Advanced degree in a related discipline or equivalent work experience required. Authorized Lead Assessor for CBA-IPI, SCE, SCAMPI, ISO 9000 methodology or Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification required, 10+ years of experience in systems and project management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

10+ years of related agile, organizational change and process improvement expertise required, Knowledge of Lean, SAFe, SCRUM, and Kanban required.  
Certifications in SAFe, Scrum, Kanban preferred. 
Knowledge of Capability Maturity Models preferred (CMMI)
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial.
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.  Advanced degree desirable.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. 
Experience communicating with senior level leadership (ability to lead and influence)
  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. The Pershing Technology group has an opening for a Mainframe (z/OS) Database Administrator (DBA) with experience in DB2 relational database management system to support our operational transactional financial application systems. The DB2 DBA will be a member of the technology team working on application database projects and requested development and production support services. 
   
 The qualified candidate will work closely with application development teams to design and maintain database environments, perform database object creation and migrations, perform DB2 data refreshes to support application testing, SQL performance and tuning.Individual will be required to provide 24/7 DBA coverage on a rotating basis, support production migrations and disaster recovery exercises. Candidate should have experience with performing database Backups, Recoveries, Reorgs, Unloads, Loads, and a good understanding of COBOL program packages and plans within DB2 and Stored Procedure development.  
   
 Sr. Specialist Database Analyst->> Designs, implements, and supports database management structures, as well as database back-up, recovery, security, archiving and conversion strategies. Collaborates with application development teams on various database issues and takes a lead role in problem resolution. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine database/system platform selection, efficient database design, and access. Provides technical assistance and mentoring to staff in all areas of database support. Designs, implements, and maintains physical database structures and associated network and system configurations. Manages data, maintaining data integrity, using effective utility and disk management procedures. Monitors database and replication servers for resource utilization. Uses knowledge and expertise of existing database environments to make recommendations for opportunities to share data and/or reduce data redundancies. Assists database team in providing problem identification and resolution support through analysis and research. Designs and administers database security strategies. Installs and configures database management system and related distributed system software as needed. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 5-7 years of experience as a DB2 Database Administrator on mainframe z/OS platform with DB2 Data Sharing experience
Production support and problem resolution
Proficient SQL performance and tuning
Logical and physical database design skills
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Good understanding of COBOL programming structure and debugging
Experience with IBM & BMC / DB2 utilities
Experience with JCL, TSO/ISPF, and z/OS utilities
Self-motivated individual and a team player
Experience with DB2 for z/OS, version 11 or higher
Experience supporting a multi-terabyte data environment
Experience supporting high throughput OLTP applications
Experience supporting applications within a DB2 data-sharing environment
Knowledge and conceptual understanding of a System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Logical and physical database design skills
Proficiency in application related performance and tuning, including extensive SQL coding tuning
Extensive Mainframe JCL experience
Detailed experience with DB2 utilities and database maintenance processing
Ability to resolve Production DB2 issues quickly and effectively

Exhibit good time management skills, independent thinking and decision-making capabilities
Off hours on-call support

Stays abreast of emerging technologies and identifies potential use of new and existing technology within lines of business by participating in industry-wide conferences and research and by using in-depth knowledge of various business areas. Educates business leaders and prepares presentations for the business on IT strategies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of Application Development objectives.
 

 Description: 
 The job holder leads the technical design, development and documentation of cross-functional, multi-platform distributed application systems. S/he analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, and logical processes and interfaces with other systems. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation. 
 Primary job responsibilities shall include: 
 • Design & development of client facing Wealth Management applications in Java, Spring Boot 
 • Design & develop secure Restful APIs using Java and Spring 
 • Participate in design, architect and build of scalable, distributed services and applications that integrate across different technologies 
 • Research into new, emerging and cutting edge technology (eg - Angular, MongoDB, Mobile App Development) 
 • Participate in Agile based software development model

 10+ years of overall experience required and a BE/BS graduate. S/he must be experienced with new application development as well as application support. S/he must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to quickly learn new application systems and technology. Need the ability to accurately break down complex application designs into component deliverables and estimate design and development timelines. Must have proficiency in programming languages and has the ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing

 • Strong communicator, both face to face and remote with experience of communicating to the Senior Leadership of an organization, ability to interact with the business to understand requirements and perform technology analysis

Principal Project/Program Manager    Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have formal management responsibility for Program Team members. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. column2: Agile Champion - Organizational Change Agent (Principal Process Improvement Analyst)
column4:
Organizational Summary: Pershing Technology provides our business partners with client-focused, technology-based solutions. These enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions and leading-edge infrastructure. Pershing Technology provides employees with the tools and resources required to improve efficiency and productivity. Description: Lead the implementation/ adoption of Agile/Lean principles as the enhanced solution delivery methodology across the business and technology divisions. Provide expertise and leadership by helping teams adopt Agile methods and mindset to promote Agile transformation. Drive continuous process improvement through reviewing existing processes and recommending improvements or introducing new methodologies as appropriate. Identifies and provides guidance about new methodologies, tools, processes, and deliverables. Ensure process compliance by conducting process quality control. Responsibilities: •Lead process Improvement efforts and proactively manage all aspects of advancing the state of software delivery practices to ensure the processes and methods provide the appropriate balance of effectiveness and efficiency for the organization. •Function as the organizational change agent for all process improvement initiatives. Manage all process improvement initiatives roll-out including training the appropriate stakeholders and users base. •Drive enterprise agile implementation/ adoption. Develop and implement an agile framework including a comprehensive implementation plan within an aggressive timeframe. Function as an organizational change agent/ champion required for the agile transformation. Provide training and coaching on agile practices and principles including Kanban. Develop processes, tools as well as define roles and responsibilities appropriate for specific programs using the agile framework. Coach teams on product/feature planning, daily standups, retrospectives, release planning and other agile activities. Guide business owners and SME’s in backlog creation and refinement •Manage team responsible for conducting periodic internal reviews or audits to ensure process compliance of the defined software delivery processes and procedures. Work with stakeholders to remediate and close gaps for all non-compliance items. Ensure readiness for enterprise audits by external auditors. •Manage the solution delivery enterprise tool (HP-PPM). Oversee all tool enhancements required to accommodate process and reporting changes. Prioritize and oversee product backlog and sprints. •Conduct informal appraisals to assess gaps in the software delivery processes. May conduct formal appraisals in accordance with applicable standards (ex. CBA-IPI) •Facilitate communication of all process related information to all impacted stakeholders. Improve transparency across technology and business stakeholders. Principal Process Improvement Analyst->> Leads and provides innovative direction and guidance for a wide array of activities supporting the improvement of processes and procedures. Provides project/process management consulting, coaching, and training to IT teams and/or Project/Process Office staff across multiple LOBs and/or the enterprise. Assists in setting the direction on approaches/tools to build, streamline, implement, and/or automate key processes. Champions the company's project management methodology, tools and techniques. Leads formal appraisals to assess gaps in the processes used within multiple LOBs, as well as appraisals in accordance with applicable standards (e.g. CBA-IPI or SCE) for LOBs other than his/her own. Counsels one or more LOBs regarding their formal and informal assessments and checkpoints. Develops and manages project plans to support strategic process improvement or IT projects at the LOB or enterprise level. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. May manage enterprise-wide IT processes and work flows which maximize efficiency, and comply with regulatory and audit requirements. Manages and develops strategic client partnerships to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives, Qualifications Advanced degree in a related discipline or equivalent work experience required. Authorized Lead Assessor for CBA-IPI, SCE, SCAMPI, ISO 9000 methodology or Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification required, 10+ years of experience in systems and project management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

10+ years of related agile, organizational change and process improvement expertise required, Knowledge of Lean, SAFe, SCRUM, and Kanban required.  
Certifications in SAFe, Scrum, Kanban preferred. 
Knowledge of Capability Maturity Models preferred (CMMI)
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial.
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.  Advanced degree desirable.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. 
Experience communicating with senior level leadership (ability to lead and influence)

TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP
(TSG) is
the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of
innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and
cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon App
Engine technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully
integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers.
 
TSG is building next generation
scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation
infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are
aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing
virtual computing environments.
 
We are hiring a Network
Architect for the Network Services group in TSG. This role is the leader in all
aspects of network designs but will focus on data center virtualization
including VMs and containers networking designs and implementations. This role
will help develop the network strategies and network engineering best practices
to support various business critical applications.
 
Key responsibilities
include:
Leads the research, design, development of new and emerging network
technologies. Evaluates new technology, products, and services for future
networking solutions.Defines network architecture and configuration best practices for physical
and virtual networks including VXLAN, EVPN, Cisco ACI, VMWare VSphere/NSX,
Linux container networking and SDN technologies.Leads relationships with other IT groups and vendor representatives
on strategic projects including the development of the new data centers.
 
Principal Network
Engineer->> Leads the research, design, development, and the
enterprise-wide integration and implementation of new and emerging
technologies. Implements and supports the network infrastructure and systems
for large, complex networks. Designs and supports inter-network solutions
including the physical and logical configuration documentation and has an
in-depth understanding of the entire network topology and architecture. Performs
overall network design or support and on-going review of complex network
design. Works with other IT areas to define or support architectural standards.
Works and may lead relationships with other IT staff and vendor representatives
on strategic projects, installations, moves, changes, troubleshooting,
documentation and servicing for intricate network issues. Stays informed of
current industry trends and emerging technologies. Evaluates new technology,
products, and services for potential and opportunity as future networking
solutions or upgrade/replacement. Contributes to the achievement of area
objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related discipline, or
equivalent work experience is required; advanced degree is preferred.10-12 years of experience in designing, implementing, and
supporting secure high-traffic networks is required; Previous Network Architect
/ Solution Architect experience preferred.3-4 years of experience in designing and implementing virtualized
network infrastructure based on VXLAN, EVPN, Cisco ACI, VMware VSphere/NSX and
SDN technologies.1-2 years of experience in Linux Container networking.1-2 years of experience in network programmability. Experience
with model-driven programmability stack including JSON and XML encoding,
NETCONF, RESTCONF and REST protocols and YANG framework.1-2 years of experience in developing IaaS and SaaS public Cloud
networking strategies and security.Preferred Certifications: 
CCIE, VCP, AWS, CISSPExperience in the securities or financial
services industry is a plus. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Senior Specialist Developer - Agile JAVA/Angular/Python Developer and Integrator
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, New York; Brooklyn, New York
column4:
This position is part of the BNY Mellon Information Lifecycle Management group, responsible for building and buying solutions to support Cyber Security Data Masking, Records Management, Application Archive and eDiscovery/Legal Hold workflows across the vast array of enterprise data.  This broad mandate creates varied and exciting opportunities for an experienced developer with strong integration skills interested in tackling big data issues.  We work in small, highly motivated, self-directed team primarily in the NY Metro area leveraging Pune production support staff.  
 
Join the Information Lifecycle Management team with your skills and knowledge of JAVA and coding APIs, in building Data Masking as a Service in support of BNY Mellon's Cyber Security initiatives.  You will be responsible to take part in conducting OOAD, modeling the solution, develop and test code, deploy the service and provide ongoing application support in the Information Lifecycle Management department.  The service will support new technological data stores coming into use at BNY Mellon.  You will have opportunity to keep your knowledge current in new technologies i.e. Hadoop, MongoDB, MariaDB, etc.
 
Key Responsibilities Include:


Participate in object-oriented analysis and design among the development team 
Develop JAVA classes in support of the application model, using the BNY Mellon Application Engine
Application Program Interface (API) design and coding
Work with contemporary data stores, i.e., Hadoop, MongoDB, MariaDB and the Cloud
Code and debug Python code
Design and build artificial intelligence discovery capability
Ongoing extension of the application's original release and application support
Understand data masking and the regulations and BNY Mellon policy for protecting personal information in non-production environments   
Provide ongoing service support to internal clients of the service

 
Sr. Specialist Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required.
Ten to twelve (8-10) years of experience in software development is required.
Expertise in JAVA, Python, and Agile development: APIs and various SDKs is required.
Experience with Windows and Linux OS, SFTP, NDM, WAS, LDAP, configuration is required.
Good communication skills are required.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. 
Experience in cyber security / records management a plus. 
Knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning is a plus. 
 BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Specialist Business Analysis Consultant->> Analyzes, defines and prioritizes the business requirements, functional specifications and operational architecture for up to and including  highly complex strategic, global programs. Provides consultation to IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities and planning and implementing cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes requirements using standard processes and templates, and translates into functional design and use case documents. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a given large, strategic, multi-year project. Participates and provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation. Tracks scope and change throughout the remainder of the initiative utilizing formal requirements management principles, including change control and requirements traceability. Gathers and analyzes information to assist in development of recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to develop better processes to be used in the future. Actively influences software development process improvement initiatives. Provides senior level consultation to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 6-8 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. The Pershing Technology group has an opening for a Mainframe (z/OS) Database Administrator (DBA) with experience in DB2 relational database management system to support our operational transactional financial application systems. The DB2 DBA will be a member of the technology team working on application database projects and requested development and production support services. 
   
 The qualified candidate will work closely with application development teams to design and maintain database environments, perform database object creation and migrations, perform DB2 data refreshes to support application testing, SQL performance and tuning.Individual will be required to provide 24/7 DBA coverage on a rotating basis, support production migrations and disaster recovery exercises. Candidate should have experience with performing database Backups, Recoveries, Reorgs, Unloads, Loads, and a good understanding of COBOL program packages and plans within DB2 and Stored Procedure development.  
   
 Sr. Specialist Database Analyst->> Designs, implements, and supports database management structures, as well as database back-up, recovery, security, archiving and conversion strategies. Collaborates with application development teams on various database issues and takes a lead role in problem resolution. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine database/system platform selection, efficient database design, and access. Provides technical assistance and mentoring to staff in all areas of database support. Designs, implements, and maintains physical database structures and associated network and system configurations. Manages data, maintaining data integrity, using effective utility and disk management procedures. Monitors database and replication servers for resource utilization. Uses knowledge and expertise of existing database environments to make recommendations for opportunities to share data and/or reduce data redundancies. Assists database team in providing problem identification and resolution support through analysis and research. Designs and administers database security strategies. Installs and configures database management system and related distributed system software as needed. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.   Qualifications Preferred Skills / Qualifications: 

5-7 years of experience as a DB2 Database Administrator on mainframe z/OS platform with DB2 Data Sharing experience
Production support and problem resolution
Proficient SQL performance and tuning
Logical and physical database design skills
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Good understanding of COBOL programming structure and debugging
Experience with IBM & BMC / DB2 utilities
Experience with JCL, TSO/ISPF, and z/OS utilities
Self-motivated individual and a team player
Experience with DB2 for z/OS, version 11 or higher
Experience supporting a multi-terabyte data environment
Experience supporting high throughput OLTP applications
Experience supporting applications within a DB2 data-sharing environment
Knowledge and conceptual understanding of a System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Logical and physical database design skills
Proficiency in application related performance and tuning, including extensive SQL coding tuning
Extensive Mainframe JCL experience
Detailed experience with DB2 utilities and database maintenance processing
Ability to resolve Production DB2 issues quickly and effectively
Working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint for management reporting purposes
Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills
Clear, concise and effective written and verbal communication skills
Exhibit good time management skills, independent thinking and decision-making capabilities
Off hours on-call support
   
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in design and administration of logical and relational databases or systems analysis required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
