column4:
TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP
(TSG) is
the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of
innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and
cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon App
Engine technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully
integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers.
 
TSG is building next generation
scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation
infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are
aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing
virtual computing environments.
 
We are hiring a Network
Architect for the Network Services group in TSG. This role is the leader in all
aspects of network designs but will focus on data center virtualization
including VMs and containers networking designs and implementations. This role
will help develop the network strategies and network engineering best practices
to support various business critical applications.
 
Key responsibilities
include:
Leads the research, design, development of new and emerging network
technologies. Evaluates new technology, products, and services for future
networking solutions.Defines network architecture and configuration best practices for physical
and virtual networks including VXLAN, EVPN, Cisco ACI, VMWare VSphere/NSX,
Linux container networking and SDN technologies.Leads relationships with other IT groups and vendor representatives
on strategic projects including the development of the new data centers.
 
Principal Network
Engineer->> Leads the research, design, development, and the
enterprise-wide integration and implementation of new and emerging
technologies. Implements and supports the network infrastructure and systems
for large, complex networks. Designs and supports inter-network solutions
including the physical and logical configuration documentation and has an
in-depth understanding of the entire network topology and architecture. Performs
overall network design or support and on-going review of complex network
design. Works with other IT areas to define or support architectural standards.
Works and may lead relationships with other IT staff and vendor representatives
on strategic projects, installations, moves, changes, troubleshooting,
documentation and servicing for intricate network issues. Stays informed of
current industry trends and emerging technologies. Evaluates new technology,
products, and services for potential and opportunity as future networking
solutions or upgrade/replacement. Contributes to the achievement of area
objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related discipline, or
equivalent work experience is required; advanced degree is preferred.10-12 years of experience in designing, implementing, and
supporting secure high-traffic networks is required; Previous Network Architect
/ Solution Architect experience preferred.3-4 years of experience in designing and implementing virtualized
network infrastructure based on VXLAN, EVPN, Cisco ACI, VMware VSphere/NSX and
SDN technologies.1-2 years of experience in Linux Container networking.1-2 years of experience in network programmability. Experience
with model-driven programmability stack including JSON and XML encoding,
NETCONF, RESTCONF and REST protocols and YANG framework.1-2 years of experience in developing IaaS and SaaS public Cloud
networking strategies and security.Preferred Certifications: 
CCIE, VCP, AWS, CISSPExperience in the securities or financial
services industry is a plus. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. The Pershing Technology group has an opening for a Mainframe (z/OS) Database Administrator (DBA) with experience in DB2 relational database management system to support our operational transactional financial application systems. The DB2 DBA will be a member of the technology team working on application database projects and requested development and production support services. 
   
 The qualified candidate will work closely with application development teams to design and maintain database environments, perform database object creation and migrations, perform DB2 data refreshes to support application testing, SQL performance and tuning.Individual will be required to provide 24/7 DBA coverage on a rotating basis, support production migrations and disaster recovery exercises. Candidate should have experience with performing database Backups, Recoveries, Reorgs, Unloads, Loads, and a good understanding of COBOL program packages and plans within DB2 and Stored Procedure development.  
   
 Sr. Specialist Database Analyst->> Designs, implements, and supports database management structures, as well as database back-up, recovery, security, archiving and conversion strategies. Collaborates with application development teams on various database issues and takes a lead role in problem resolution. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine database/system platform selection, efficient database design, and access. Provides technical assistance and mentoring to staff in all areas of database support. Designs, implements, and maintains physical database structures and associated network and system configurations. Manages data, maintaining data integrity, using effective utility and disk management procedures. Monitors database and replication servers for resource utilization. Uses knowledge and expertise of existing database environments to make recommendations for opportunities to share data and/or reduce data redundancies. Assists database team in providing problem identification and resolution support through analysis and research. Designs and administers database security strategies. Installs and configures database management system and related distributed system software as needed. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.   Qualifications Preferred Skills / Qualifications: 

5-7 years of experience as a DB2 Database Administrator on mainframe z/OS platform with DB2 Data Sharing experience
Production support and problem resolution
Proficient SQL performance and tuning
Logical and physical database design skills
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Good understanding of COBOL programming structure and debugging
Experience with IBM & BMC / DB2 utilities
Experience with JCL, TSO/ISPF, and z/OS utilities
Self-motivated individual and a team player
Experience with DB2 for z/OS, version 11 or higher
Experience supporting a multi-terabyte data environment
Experience supporting high throughput OLTP applications
Experience supporting applications within a DB2 data-sharing environment
Knowledge and conceptual understanding of a System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Logical and physical database design skills
Proficiency in application related performance and tuning, including extensive SQL coding tuning
Extensive Mainframe JCL experience
Detailed experience with DB2 utilities and database maintenance processing
Ability to resolve Production DB2 issues quickly and effectively
Working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint for management reporting purposes
Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills
Clear, concise and effective written and verbal communication skills
Exhibit good time management skills, independent thinking and decision-making capabilities
Off hours on-call support
   
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in design and administration of logical and relational databases or systems analysis required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Team Profile 
 The Collateral & Clearance Technology group is responsible for building high-performance critical market platforms. The group designs, builds and supports the platform used for US Triparty Repo and Global Collateral Services solutions. This service has 85% of the US Triparty Repo business with $2.7trn of assets globally. This group supports the most critical client-facing services for BNY Mellon.  
   
 The group’s responsibility is building solutions to help our clients in collateral sourcing, collateral optimization and high-performance real-time transaction processing. Our collateral optimizer was the finalist in the Franz Edelman Award – considered the highest honor in Operations Research.  
   
 After the financial crisis, the Basel 3 regulations focused on the funding and liquidity efficiencies of the sell-side banks and the derivative margin positing for the buy-side. In order to meet these new market challenges, our group is working on building our next-generation collateral platform. The new platform will be built with strong big-data analytic capabilities to deliver to future client and regulatory requirements. Considering the mission-critical nature of the platform, we plan to invest significantly into the core engineering to address high-performance, high-availability, big-data, machine-learning and information risk at the outset.  
   
 The work environment is extremely fast-paced with very high levels of collaboration with global product managers (London & New York) and clients. We are looking at developers who are hands-on and able to face-off to the clients in designing solutions.    Role
We are
looking for strong hands-on developers who are excited about building this next
generation system. They will have the unique opportunity to build a
sophisticated high performance capital markets system using the latest
technology stack and best software engineering practices. They will become the members
of the core team driving it forward and will have a significant impact in how
it’s implemented.

Consults to IT and business managers on issues, questions and problems related to his/her area of expertise. Accountable for resolving highly complex problems that have impact on the corporation's ability to conduct business. Uses in-depth knowledge of various technologies to establish and influence implementation of broad-based technology strategy for large IT Divisions. Stays abreast of emerging technologies and identifies potential use of new and existing technology within lines of business by participating in industry-wide conferences and research and by using in-depth knowledge of various business areas. Educates business leaders and prepares presentations for the business on IT strategies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of Application Development objectives. Qualifications
 Specific Qualifications
BS or MS (Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering)10+ years of overall experienceStrong CS fundamentals, core Java, and multi-threading are requiredGood software engineering problem solving skillsExperience building distributed high-performance, high-availability systemsExperience with and strong understanding of capital markets is preferredExperience working in a strong agile environment is preferred

Sr. Principal Project/Program Manager 
 
 
  Leads and provides innovative direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities of highly complex projects involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization. Owns formal definition, documentation, and communication of overall program scope and objectives. Manages all changes to the scope and requirements through a formally defined change control process. Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have leadership responsibility for Program Team members. Acts as the primary interface between technology infrastructure and a specific business/functional area. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of Project/Program Management objectives.   Qualifications Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. 

Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial

12 + years of project management experience required

Experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and
its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the
financial services market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading
edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with
enterprise standards for developers. TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient
data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building
on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating
and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing
environments. We
are an Enterprise Monitoring and Automation Team recently formed to engineer
the next generation Monitoring and Automation solution within TSG.  We are
engineering a full stack monitoring and automation platform utilizing open
source software (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Spring, etc.), commercial software
(AppDynamics, Moogsoft, etc.) and home-grown software.  We are a
distributed team with wide range of development and system skills that seek to
produce robust, yet simple solutions to problems.  We are hiring people
who are self-starters who can work independently with minimal direction. Key responsibilities include:Development of a near
real-time dashboard pulling data from multiple sources across the BNY Mellon
enterprise.Working independently to
contribute to a large team delivering solutions to the meet the needs of

Team Profile 
 The Collateral & Clearance Technology group is responsible for building high-performance critical market platforms. The group designs, builds and supports the platform used for US Triparty Repo and Global Collateral Services solutions. This service has 85% of the US Triparty Repo business with $2.7trn of assets globally. This group supports the most critical client-facing services for BNY Mellon.  
   
 The group’s responsibility is building solutions to help our clients in collateral sourcing, collateral optimization and high-performance real-time transaction processing. Our collateral optimizer was the finalist in the Franz Edelman Award – considered the highest honor in Operations Research.  
   
 After the financial crisis, the Basel 3 regulations focused on the funding and liquidity efficiencies of the sell-side banks and the derivative margin positing for the buy-side. In order to meet these new market challenges, our group is working on building our next-generation collateral platform. The new platform will be built with strong big-data analytic capabilities to deliver to future client and regulatory requirements. Considering the mission-critical nature of the platform, we plan to invest significantly into the core engineering to address high-performance, high-availability, big-data, machine-learning and information risk at the outset.  
   
 The work environment is extremely fast-paced with very high levels of collaboration with global product managers (London & New York) and clients. We are looking at developers who are hands-on and able to face-off to the clients in designing solutions.    Role
We are
looking for strong hands-on developers who are excited about building this next
generation system. They will have the unique opportunity to build a
sophisticated high performance capital markets system using the latest
technology stack and best software engineering practices. They will become the members
of the core team driving it forward and will have a significant impact in how
it’s implemented.

Stays abreast of emerging technologies and identifies potential use of new and existing technology within lines of business by participating in industry-wide conferences and research and by using in-depth knowledge of various business areas. Educates business leaders and prepares presentations for the business on IT strategies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of Application Development objectives. Qualifications
 Specific Qualifications

Sr. Principal Project/Program Manager 
 
 
  Leads and provides innovative direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities of highly complex projects involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization. Owns formal definition, documentation, and communication of overall program scope and objectives. Manages all changes to the scope and requirements through a formally defined change control process. Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have leadership responsibility for Program Team members. Acts as the primary interface between technology infrastructure and a specific business/functional area. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of Project/Program Management objectives.   Qualifications Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. 

Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial

12 + years of project management experience required

Experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. Principal Quality Assurance/Automation Testing Analyst – Financial Services
Defines and maintains highly complex test system configurations and writes test scripts for complex integrated systems in large scale projects. Provides detailed test strategy, both functional/automation and technical guidance to assigned project teams. Leads quality assurance and testing projects, including developing and monitoring project plans and budgets. Implements strategic procedures and policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Presents results to Quality Assurance leadership. Analyzes highly complex systems requirements. Resolves highly complex problems detected in testing. Analyzes the effectiveness of the use of technology in QA processes. Uses technical expertise to recommend new products and provide guidance and expertise in their development. Provides innovative direction and guidance on reports, communications, and training materials and ensures recommendations are aligned with customer/organization needs and capabilities. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  Qualifications

Participates in and identifies specific tests while executing test scenarios for unit, process, function, system integration, regression and acceptance testing. Defines criteria for testing, analyzes results of testing sessions and presents testing results to project stakeholders. Reviews applicable requirements in order to develop complex test cases, scenarios and scripts to ensure application quality. Designs and develops usability testing scenarios, and administers portions of the testing process. Writes test plans, collaborating with other QA and business teams. Uses testing tools to plan, execute and track quality assurance artifacts. Escalates defects and issues that need remediation. Performs testing activities based upon test plans and scripts. Executes testing independently. Identifies and documents software and systems defects across products, platforms, and releases. Analyzes detailed systems requirements, in order to verify that programs function according to actual requirements and established guidelines. Helps resolve problems detected in testing. Provides triage support to Development, Business and Test teams on internal and external issues. Attends product definition and design meetings, functional and technical walkthroughs in order to participate in the selection of testing tools and approaches. Identifies test data, test environment setup and test environment configurations needed to prepare for testing.  Qualifications

services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and
its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the
financial services market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading
edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with
enterprise standards for developers. TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient
data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building
on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating
and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing
environments. We
are an Enterprise Monitoring and Automation Team recently formed to engineer
the next generation Monitoring and Automation solution within TSG.  We are
engineering a full stack monitoring and automation platform utilizing open
source software (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Spring, etc.), commercial software
(AppDynamics, Moogsoft, etc.) and home-grown software.  We are a
distributed team with wide range of development and system skills that seek to
produce robust, yet simple solutions to problems.  We are hiring people
who are self-starters who can work independently with minimal direction. Key responsibilities include:Development of a near
real-time dashboard pulling data from multiple sources across the BNY Mellon
enterprise.Working independently to
contribute to a large team delivering solutions to the meet the needs of
executive management as well as the general employee population.

Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required. Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle.  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG) is the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers.
 
TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing environments.
 
We are an Enterprise Monitoring and Automation Team recently formed to engineer the next generation Monitoring and Automation solution within TSG.  We are engineering a full stack monitoring and automation platform utilizing open source software (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Spring, etc.), commercial software (AppDynamics, Moogsoft, etc.) and home-grown software.  We are a distributed team with wide range of development and system skills that seek to produce robust, yet simple solutions to problems.  We are hiring people that are self-starters who can work independently with minimal direction.
 
Key responsibilities include:


Liaison and point of presence to both Platform leads and Production support teams.
Engage in critical Problem and Incident resolution and ensure stability across the enterprise.
Ensure Monitoring systems are patched to standard and configuration and code levels are current.
Ensure Monitoring systems are fully operational and they meet both application and infrastructure needs.
Detailed understand of the infrastructure and applications as they relate to telemetry, operations, and visualization products.

 
Principal Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support. Provides comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staffs. Evaluates compliance with the organization's technology standards. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Guides and consults with IT management and technical staffs regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services. Participates in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required.
Ten to twelve (10-12) years of experience in software development is required.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Ten or more (10+) years of experience in both networking and application tooling is preferred.
Familiarity of key programming languages (Java, Spring, JDBC).
Strong understanding of networking protocols such as TCP, UDP, HTTPS and DNS.
Familiarity of Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Spine/Leaf architecture.
Experience with routing and switching protocols such as OSPF, BGP and STP in a large enterprise environment.
Strong understanding of Active Directory, LDAP and authentication protocols and load balancing strategy.
Solid understanding of Windows, Linux and Unix environments and navigating within each platform.
Strong organization skills, self-motivated, well spoken, and ability to work independently with minimal direction.
Experience with both network and application performance monitoring tools (Orion, Netbrain, nGeniusONE, Prometheus/Grafana, App Dynamics and Moogsoft) is a plus.
Experience or exposure to a DevOps role with a passion for stable, resilient and available platforms is a plus.
Experience with Wire Analytics and the ability to decode a packet trace for flow analysis is a strong plus.
Familiarity of Unified Communications, VoIP mobility, wireless, load balancing and firewall technologies is a plus.
Credentials for CCNA, CCNP, CCIE and MCSE is a plus. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column4:
Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) team is looking to hire a
mid-level Executive Assistant (EA) to independently complete the full range of advanced
administrative activities to support one or more executives, who are
responsible for leading the CCT organization of ~400 employees and consultants,
globally. 
EA’s tasks are frequently diverse, highly complex
in nature and may include but are not limited to, calendar management, travel
booking, expense reporting, word processing, data entry. Effectively prioritizes the needs of the office,
executive(s) and/or team as prescribed by established guidelines, managing
competing requests and switching focus as needed; often must negotiate
prioritization of administrative activities with/among higher level team
members/managers. Screens calls and visitors, and resolves
inquiries. Sets up filing/organizational procedures. Manages supply orders and
resolves associated issues on behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team.Schedules meetings, prepares and distributes
meeting agendas and minutes. Often independently creates and disseminates
draft/final draft correspondence; copies, files and processes related
documentation. May review those drafted by the executive's direct reports or
other support staff for accuracy. Other activities often reflect some elements of
the professional discipline supported, including beginning level
bookkeeping/accounting and compliance. May review and analyze complex data, assist with
expense management and development of budgets, accounts payables/receivables on
behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team. Liaises with the executive(s)
and direct reports to prepare budget presentations for review and use by the
assigned executive(s). Priority is on daily/weekly work, but will be
responsible for executing longer term work/projects as requested.  Qualifications  High school/secondary school or the equivalent
combination of education and experience is required; Bachelor’s degree
preferred. Applicable vocational training (e.g., courses on
relevant business software like the Microsoft Office Suite of products, basic
business writing, or similar) preferred; AA degree or relevant business
certifications preferred.Should be digitally inclined and tech savvy - intermediate to advanced user of standard
business software (MS Office Suite – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).5-7 years of experience as an Executive Assistant
supporting senior IT executives at large global corporations; previous
Financial Industry experience strongly preferred.Effective collaboration and communication skills
are required to interact with external and internal contacts at all levels.Should be self-starter and able to work independently
in a fast faced environment.Tact, diplomacy and confidentiality are essential
skills based on the level of internal and external contacts.Has significant latitude to adjust daily work
routines as needed.Bachelor's degree in lieu of some experience may
be considered.
  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. JOB DESCRIPTION: 
 ·       Develops testing plan scenarios for complex unit, process, function, integration and acceptance testing. Responsible for definition, planning and execution of testing efforts. Provides technical guidance to assigned project teams. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Develops test cases, scenarios and scripts to ensure applications quality. Designs and develops usability testing scenarios, and administers more complex portions of the testing process. Defines criteria for testing, analyzes results of testing sessions and presents results to Quality Assurance leadership. Analyzes complex systems requirements.  
 ·       Participates in selection of testing tools and approaches. 
 ·       Attend product definition and design meetings, functional and technical walkthroughs in order to participate in the selection of testing tools and approaches.   
 ·       Identify test data, test environment setup and  test environment  configurations needed to prepare for testing.   
 ·       Analyzes detailed systems requirements, in order to verify that programs function according to actual requirements and established guidelines 
   
   
 ·       Create automated test cases using scriptless automation framework leveraging tools such as Selenium and Microfocus UFT 
 ·       Operate as a member of a scrum, conducting manual and automated testing using Agile, CI/CD development and testing process 
   
   
 ·       Helps resolve complex problems detected in testing. Recommends new products and provide guidance and expertise in their development. Identifies and documents software and systems defects. Assists in providing solutions to resolve defects. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. . Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree is beneficial,
 6-8+ years of experience in a systems quality environment required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
4+ years with automation experience, preferred. For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.Pershing provides critical business process, financial and technology solutions for financial organizations around the globe. 
 
We operate behind the scenes to power transformational change for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, independent financial advisers, hedge fund and '40 Act fund managers and individual investors. 
 
We strive to be innovators, developing open architecture technology and financial solutions to support our customers' growth. We advocate on behalf of our customers and help them respond to regulatory reform and drive positive outcomes for our industry and investors.
 
From our core business as an industry-leading trade execution, clearing and custody provider, we have evolved into a global multifaceted firm that provides investment solutions, forward-thinking technology-driven efficiencies, practice management and service excellence.BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. The ACH (Automated Clearing House) application is a legacy batch / online processing and delivery system that provides for the distribution and settlement of electronic debits and credits.  It is an inexpensive transfer of funds.  The system objective is to process customized client payments that include settlement and selected reporting in a timely efficient manner while meeting the established NACHA windows.  
   
 ACH is seeking an experienced Cobol, CICS, DB2 Sr. Specialist Project/Program Mgr. The candidate should expect the opportunity to be a significant contributor to a globally diverse technology team and will be challenged to identify and execute on solutions for our internal business groups.  The ideal candidate has worked in the financial services industry and possesses in-depth knowledge of payment services, experience delivering on concurrent, complex application development projects and an understanding of mainframe technology platforms. The primary responsibilities include; 


Working with the application software development services for medium to large sized projects.
Responsibility for all facets of the BNYM development life cycle from Planning through Implementation. 
Plays a key role in design, construction and testing - ensuring a high quality product for implementation.
Collaborating with team members to perform all change management practices and policies related to coding, testing and implementation activities.
Awareness and compliance of all risk and compliance controls.
Ensuring application performance standards are appropriately defined and achieved.
Collaborating with ACH business partners to identify and implement appropriate solutions.
 
Lead Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in situations of moderate complexity. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. Writes new programs of moderate complexity and scope, working with basic application system designs and specifications, utilizing BNY Mellon's standard development methodology, procedures and techniques. Designs and codes programs, and creates test transactions and runs tests to find errors and revise programs. Prepares the final and detailed versions of system modification requirements, ensures turnovers are done on time and correctly. Interfaces with architects to design, code, test and implement application programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications Preferred Qualifications  


Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. 
Eight to ten (5-7) years of experience in software development required. 
Hands-on experience in COBOL, JCL, CICS, DB2 Mainframe development.  MQ Series and NAS knowledge is a plus.
Experience in the Payments services industry is preferred. 
Strong communication skills (verbal and written) are required.
Prior knowledge of ACH processing, especially NACHA, and/or The Clearing House is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 4-6 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus, should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle. column2: Principal Business Analysis Consultant - Technology Governance and Oversight
column4:
Key Responsibilities:


 Provides technical leadership for the Technology Governance and Oversight team of BNYM SA/NV 


 Serves as the owner of the Technology Governance and Oversight framework, ensure quality of the deliverables in a timely manner and monitor the performance of the Technology services provided through de different pillars of the framework. 


 Provides expertise and guidance to BNYM SA/NV lines of business. Assists teams to elicit, challenge, and prioritize requirements, help translating into functional design and use case models.  


 Participate with the business owner and technology partner to the project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a large, strategic, multi-year program. Provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Ensure compliance with the CAP regulation 


 Gathers and analyzes information and provides recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas.  


 Participates in corporate and industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. 


 Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to define and collect metrics and develop better processes to be used in the future. 


 Contributes to the achievement of the Technology Governance and Oversight program objectives.  
  Qualifications 

 Bachelor's degree in Technology, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred  


 10-12 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required 


 Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus 


 Fluent in English (oral and written).  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: Belgium-Brussels-Capital Region-Brussels Job: Information Technology Internal Jobcode: 60195 Organization: Asset Servicing Technology-HR07302 Requisition Number: 1817635

column4:
Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) team is looking to hire a
mid-level Executive Assistant (EA) to independently complete the full range of advanced
administrative activities to support one or more executives, who are
responsible for leading the CCT organization of ~400 employees and consultants,
globally. 
EA’s tasks are frequently diverse, highly complex
in nature and may include but are not limited to, calendar management, travel
booking, expense reporting, word processing, data entry. Effectively prioritizes the needs of the office,
executive(s) and/or team as prescribed by established guidelines, managing
competing requests and switching focus as needed; often must negotiate
prioritization of administrative activities with/among higher level team
members/managers. Screens calls and visitors, and resolves
inquiries. Sets up filing/organizational procedures. Manages supply orders and
resolves associated issues on behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team.Schedules meetings, prepares and distributes
meeting agendas and minutes. Often independently creates and disseminates
draft/final draft correspondence; copies, files and processes related
documentation. May review those drafted by the executive's direct reports or
other support staff for accuracy. Other activities often reflect some elements of
the professional discipline supported, including beginning level
bookkeeping/accounting and compliance. May review and analyze complex data, assist with
expense management and development of budgets, accounts payables/receivables on
behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team. Liaises with the executive(s)
and direct reports to prepare budget presentations for review and use by the
assigned executive(s). Priority is on daily/weekly work, but will be
responsible for executing longer term work/projects as requested.  Qualifications  High school/secondary school or the equivalent
combination of education and experience is required; Bachelor’s degree
preferred. Applicable vocational training (e.g., courses on
relevant business software like the Microsoft Office Suite of products, basic
business writing, or similar) preferred; AA degree or relevant business
certifications preferred.Should be digitally inclined and tech savvy - intermediate to advanced user of standard
business software (MS Office Suite – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).5-7 years of experience as an Executive Assistant
supporting senior IT executives at large global corporations; previous
Financial Industry experience strongly preferred.Effective collaboration and communication skills
are required to interact with external and internal contacts at all levels.Should be self-starter and able to work independently
in a fast faced environment.Tact, diplomacy and confidentiality are essential
skills based on the level of internal and external contacts.Has significant latitude to adjust daily work
routines as needed.Bachelor's degree in lieu of some experience may
be considered.
  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. JOB DESCRIPTION: 
 ·       Develops testing plan scenarios for complex unit, process, function, integration and acceptance testing. Responsible for definition, planning and execution of testing efforts. Provides technical guidance to assigned project teams. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Develops test cases, scenarios and scripts to ensure applications quality. Designs and develops usability testing scenarios, and administers more complex portions of the testing process. Defines criteria for testing, analyzes results of testing sessions and presents results to Quality Assurance leadership. Analyzes complex systems requirements.  
 ·       Participates in selection of testing tools and approaches. 
 ·       Attend product definition and design meetings, functional and technical walkthroughs in order to participate in the selection of testing tools and approaches.   
 ·       Identify test data, test environment setup and  test environment  configurations needed to prepare for testing.   
 ·       Analyzes detailed systems requirements, in order to verify that programs function according to actual requirements and established guidelines 
   
   
 ·       Create automated test cases using scriptless automation framework leveraging tools such as Selenium and Microfocus UFT 
 ·       Operate as a member of a scrum, conducting manual and automated testing using Agile, CI/CD development and testing process 
   
   
 ·       Helps resolve complex problems detected in testing. Recommends new products and provide guidance and expertise in their development. Identifies and documents software and systems defects. Assists in providing solutions to resolve defects. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. . Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree is beneficial,
 6-8+ years of experience in a systems quality environment required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
4+ years with automation experience, preferred. The ACH (Automated Clearing House) application is a legacy batch / online processing and delivery system that provides for the distribution and settlement of electronic debits and credits.  It is an inexpensive transfer of funds.  The system objective is to process customized client payments that include settlement and selected reporting in a timely efficient manner while meeting the established NACHA windows.  
   
 ACH is seeking an experienced Cobol, CICS, DB2 Sr. Specialist Project/Program Mgr. The candidate should expect the opportunity to be a significant contributor to a globally diverse technology team and will be challenged to identify and execute on solutions for our internal business groups.  The ideal candidate has worked in the financial services industry and possesses in-depth knowledge of payment services, experience delivering on concurrent, complex application development projects and an understanding of mainframe technology platforms. The primary responsibilities include; 


Working with the application software development services for medium to large sized projects.
Responsibility for all facets of the BNYM development life cycle from Planning through Implementation. 
Plays a key role in design, construction and testing - ensuring a high quality product for implementation.
Collaborating with team members to perform all change management practices and policies related to coding, testing and implementation activities.
Awareness and compliance of all risk and compliance controls.
Ensuring application performance standards are appropriately defined and achieved.
Collaborating with ACH business partners to identify and implement appropriate solutions.
 
Lead Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in situations of moderate complexity. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. Writes new programs of moderate complexity and scope, working with basic application system designs and specifications, utilizing BNY Mellon's standard development methodology, procedures and techniques. Designs and codes programs, and creates test transactions and runs tests to find errors and revise programs. Prepares the final and detailed versions of system modification requirements, ensures turnovers are done on time and correctly. Interfaces with architects to design, code, test and implement application programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications Preferred Qualifications  


Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. 
Eight to ten (5-7) years of experience in software development required. 
Hands-on experience in COBOL, JCL, CICS, DB2 Mainframe development.  MQ Series and NAS knowledge is a plus.
Experience in the Payments services industry is preferred. 
Strong communication skills (verbal and written) are required.
Prior knowledge of ACH processing, especially NACHA, and/or The Clearing House is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 4-6 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus, should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle. For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers. 
   
 Pershing provides critical business process, financial and technology solutions for financial organizations around the globe. We operate behind the scenes to power transformational change for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, independent financial advisers, hedge fund and '40 Act fund managers and individual investors. We strive to be innovators, developing open architecture technology and financial solutions to support our customers' growth. We advocate on behalf of our customers and help them respond to regulatory reform and drive positive outcomes for our industry and investors. From our core business as an industry-leading trade execution, clearing and custody provider, we have evolved into a global multifaceted firm that provides investment solutions, forward-thinking technology-driven efficiencies, practice management and service excellence. 
   
 Description 
 Maintains and supports complex applications and their operating environments. Provides technical and/or business guidance to the SCM team as well as other groups. Ensures projects are meeting plans and objectives. Analyzes system requirements. Reviews and evaluates plans for major projects and initiatives to ensure they meet system needs. Coordinates the monitoring of major changes to applications and their operating environment. Analyzes any issues of high complexity. Standardizes the use of tools, technologies, and/or business expertise in relationship to testing approaches. Monitors and analyzes the effectiveness of the use of technology in QA processes. Structures activities based upon approved project methodologies. Collects and analyzes project data and produces progress reports. Ensures the availability of applications for the client as well as problem management and resolution.  Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  
   
 The preferred candidate will be an experienced and well-rounded IT leader with a background in Production Services.   The position will entail the oversight of Pershing’s Production Services teams, which will require that the candidate possess the flexibility to provide support during weekdays, weeknights and weekends, as required, to drive the mitigation of platform outages and to ensure optimal availability and stability of Pershing’s systems.  The position will report into the Managing Director for Application Optimization, Data Management and Infrastructure Relationship Services.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree is beneficial, 12+ years of diverse experience in multiple areas of information technology required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
 
·        10-12 years of diverse technical experience with exposure to multiple areas of infrastructure technologies is required, including Distributed Hosting, Network, Database, Storage, Mainframe, File Transfer, Desktop, Operations and Disaster Recovery
·        Knowledge and expertise in foundational Production Services principles, including Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Release and Deployment Management, Capacity Management, Service Level Management, Continuous Service Improvement, Event Management, Availability Management, Access Management and Vendor Management  
·        Outstanding communications and analytical skills, with a metric driven approach to determine value and effectiveness of services, processes, and technology components

column3:
Multiple Locations:

column4:
TECHNOLOGY SERVICES
GROUP (TSG) is the central
infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help
BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective
solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon BXP technology is
leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined
with enterprise standards for developers.
 
TSG is building next generation scalable,
efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure.
Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively
automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual
computing environments. This next generation infrastructure needs to be tied to
building several internal SaaS offerings such as Fax as a service, reporting as
a service, file transfer as service etc. The infrastructure team is building
self-service and low-touch infrastructure utilities that enable building the
internal SaaS offerings.
 
Goal: To support and maintain the z/OS CICS
mainframe Software and CICS Ancillary products.
 
Primary Job
Responsibilities to Include:

The candidate will be responsible for supporting
     the CICS Software and related software and subsystems.
He / she will also be responsible for supporting third
     party vendor software utilities and packages.
CICS Production
     Support team for problem and incident management, disaster recovery,
     sustained resiliency, LOB testing events, and capacity planning
     requirements as needed.
Day to Day support for problem determination and
     resolution of system software related to incident and problem tickets
     raised by customer or other technical teams.
Coordinate CICS related activities
     with other technical teams like Storage, Security, MVSetc to satisfy the
     requirement of business.
 Support for highly available, Sysplexed CICS environments

column2: Principal Developer/Consultant - Java/Python (Information Life Cycle Management)
column3:
Multiple Locations:
Brooklyn, New York; Jersey City, New Jersey; New York, New York
column4:
This position is in the BNY Mellon Information Lifecycle Management group, responsible for building and buying solutions to support Cyber Security Data Masking, Records Management, Application Archive and eDiscovery/Legal Hold workflows across the vast array of enterprise data.  This broad mandate creates varied and exciting opportunities for an experienced developer with strong integration skills interested in tackling big data issues.  We work in small, highly motivated, self-directed teams primarily in the NY Metro area leveraging Pune production support staff.  We are looking for an individual who will bring their strong technical skills to collaborate with and provide direction and guidance to the team and represent solutions to the various architecture review boards.    
 
This position is within a department of the TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG), the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient DCaaS using the latest innovative infrastructure. Building on top of BNY Mellon’s cloud deployment strength, TSG is aggressively automating and bridging the Greenfield cloud with existing virtual computing environments.
 
Current projects include:


 Full life-cycle development – The LoB Record Class/Retention Schedule Inventory and Metrics system with RESTful APIs exposed to vendor products and other in-house applications. Opportunities include Server-side and UI design, develop, build and deploy in our latest cloud environment. 

 R&D & PoCs  - Identify and plan the next-generation full (or partial) vendor or in-house solutions for records management, data masking, and analytics.   

 Integration – Combine various tools (Splunk/Dynatrace/HPOV) to provide concise monitoring dashboards, analytics and alerts on globally deployed vendor products, in-house applications and utilities.   
 
To contribute to our success as a Principal Developer, you will work with internal business and technology groups to provide application software development services and technical support from issue and requirements analysis through recommendation and solution execution.  This position requires you to provide comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staff including Enterprise Architecture & Engineering.  Work includes evaluating compliance with the organization's technology standards, recommending and executing any required remediation.  You will guides and consult with IT management and technical staff regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services.  You will participate in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies and advocate for innovative, creative technology solutions.   
 
Principal Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support. Provides comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staffs. Evaluates compliance with the organization's technology standards. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Guides and consults with IT management and technical staffs regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services. Participates in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
 
#LI-LS Qualifications 

 Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required. 

 Ten to twelve (10-12) years of experience in software development is required. 

 Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.   

 Experience in cyber security / records management a plus.   

 Expertise in JAVA, Python, Agile development: APIs and various SDKs required 

 Experience with Windows and Linux OS, SFTP, NDM, WAS, LDAP, configuration required. 

 Good communication skills required. 

 Experience with multiple DBMS (DB/2, Oracle, Hadoop, SQL Server) design, tuning and optimization preferred. 

 Experience with Agile SCRUM and Enterprise Development Life Cycle processes preferred. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers. 
   
 Pershing provides critical business process, financial and technology solutions for financial organizations around the globe. We operate behind the scenes to power transformational change for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, independent financial advisers, hedge fund and '40 Act fund managers and individual investors. We strive to be innovators, developing open architecture technology and financial solutions to support our customers' growth. We advocate on behalf of our customers and help them respond to regulatory reform and drive positive outcomes for our industry and investors. From our core business as an industry-leading trade execution, clearing and custody provider, we have evolved into a global multifaceted firm that provides investment solutions, forward-thinking technology-driven efficiencies, practice management and service excellence. 
   
 Description 
 Maintains and supports complex applications and their operating environments. Provides technical and/or business guidance to the SCM team as well as other groups. Ensures projects are meeting plans and objectives. Analyzes system requirements. Reviews and evaluates plans for major projects and initiatives to ensure they meet system needs. Coordinates the monitoring of major changes to applications and their operating environment. Analyzes any issues of high complexity. Standardizes the use of tools, technologies, and/or business expertise in relationship to testing approaches. Monitors and analyzes the effectiveness of the use of technology in QA processes. Structures activities based upon approved project methodologies. Collects and analyzes project data and produces progress reports. Ensures the availability of applications for the client as well as problem management and resolution.  Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  
   
 The preferred candidate will be an experienced and well-rounded IT leader with a background in Production Services.   The position will entail the oversight of Pershing’s Production Services teams, which will require that the candidate possess the flexibility to provide support during weekdays, weeknights and weekends, as required, to drive the mitigation of platform outages and to ensure optimal availability and stability of Pershing’s systems.  The position will report into the Managing Director for Application Optimization, Data Management and Infrastructure Relationship Services.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree is beneficial, 12+ years of diverse experience in multiple areas of information technology required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
 
·        10-12 years of diverse technical experience with exposure to multiple areas of infrastructure technologies is required, including Distributed Hosting, Network, Database, Storage, Mainframe, File Transfer, Desktop, Operations and Disaster Recovery
·        Knowledge and expertise in foundational Production Services principles, including Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Release and Deployment Management, Capacity Management, Service Level Management, Continuous Service Improvement, Event Management, Availability Management, Access Management and Vendor Management  
·        Outstanding communications and analytical skills, with a metric driven approach to determine value and effectiveness of services, processes, and technology components

column3:
Multiple Locations:
Brooklyn, New York; Jersey City, New Jersey; New York, New York
column4:
This position is in the BNY Mellon Information Lifecycle Management group, responsible for building and buying solutions to support Cyber Security Data Masking, Records Management, Application Archive and eDiscovery/Legal Hold workflows across the vast array of enterprise data.  This broad mandate creates varied and exciting opportunities for an experienced developer with strong integration skills interested in tackling big data issues.  We work in small, highly motivated, self-directed teams primarily in the NY Metro area leveraging Pune production support staff.  We are looking for an individual who will bring their strong technical skills to collaborate with and provide direction and guidance to the team and represent solutions to the various architecture review boards.    
 
This position is within a department of the TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG), the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient DCaaS using the latest innovative infrastructure. Building on top of BNY Mellon’s cloud deployment strength, TSG is aggressively automating and bridging the Greenfield cloud with existing virtual computing environments.
 
Current projects include:


 Full life-cycle development – The LoB Record Class/Retention Schedule Inventory and Metrics system with RESTful APIs exposed to vendor products and other in-house applications. Opportunities include Server-side and UI design, develop, build and deploy in our latest cloud environment. 

 R&D & PoCs  - Identify and plan the next-generation full (or partial) vendor or in-house solutions for records management, data masking, and analytics.   

 Integration – Combine various tools (Splunk/Dynatrace/HPOV) to provide concise monitoring dashboards, analytics and alerts on globally deployed vendor products, in-house applications and utilities.   
 
To contribute to our success as a Principal Developer, you will work with internal business and technology groups to provide application software development services and technical support from issue and requirements analysis through recommendation and solution execution.  This position requires you to provide comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staff including Enterprise Architecture & Engineering.  Work includes evaluating compliance with the organization's technology standards, recommending and executing any required remediation.  You will guides and consult with IT management and technical staff regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services.  You will participate in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies and advocate for innovative, creative technology solutions.   
 
Principal Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support. Provides comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staffs. Evaluates compliance with the organization's technology standards. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Guides and consults with IT management and technical staffs regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services. Participates in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
 
#LI-LS Qualifications 

 Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required. 

 Ten to twelve (10-12) years of experience in software development is required. 

 Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.   

 Experience in cyber security / records management a plus.   

 Expertise in JAVA, Python, Agile development: APIs and various SDKs required 

 Experience with Windows and Linux OS, SFTP, NDM, WAS, LDAP, configuration required. 

 Good communication skills required. 

 Experience with multiple DBMS (DB/2, Oracle, Hadoop, SQL Server) design, tuning and optimization preferred. 

 Experience with Agile SCRUM and Enterprise Development Life Cycle processes preferred.  Designs and creates highly complex logical/physical data models, and data dictionaries that cater to the specific business and functional requirements of applications. Provides knowledge and expertise in existing database environments and makes recommendations for opportunities to share data and/or reduce data redundancy. BNYM Technology has a mission to provide our business partners with technology based solutions that enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions maintained on a stable and secure infrastructure, and to provide our employees with the tools and means to enhance their professional qualifications and careers. 
   
 This primary responsibility of this role is to provide technical design, development and testing for a strategic project initiative within Supply Chain Technologies. 
   
 Key responsibilities include: 

Active contribution to Application Software development including requirements analysis, testing, performance tuning, optimization, re-use, and scalability of products; demonstrate creative, critical thinking, and troubleshooting skills.
Responsible and participate in detailed design, creation of test plan and test data, perform end-to-end testing and ensuring timely delivery of the solution
Demonstrate excellent software development skills. Strong experiences in implementation of Mainframe and associated technology such as COBOL, Endevor, ESP and JCL is a must. 
Work on mission critical systems that employ complex batch and on-line processing.
Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. 
Specialist Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Coordinates coding, testing, implementation and documentation of solution. Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 6-8 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
 
Preferred Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.
Six to eight (6-8) years of experience in software development required.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), ability to work in a team environment.
Experience in leading and collaborating with global developers.
Strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Strong design and analytical skills, effective problem solver and self-starter.
Up to date knowledge of design and development tools.
Able to articulate solutions of various levels of complexity through technical discussions.
Can work collaboratively to perform troubleshooting, root-cause analysis, and solution development.

Principal Project/Program Manager->> Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have formal management responsibility for Program Team members. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives Qualifications  Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. 
   
 Additional Required Skills: 
   
 Hands on Full Stack Developmet skills 
 - Java 
 - MVC 
 - Spring or Spring Boot 
 - Restful API's 
   
 OR 
   
 QA Automation background 
   
 Candidates will be required to be hands on in one of the areas above. time will be split between SCRUM and hands on. Organizational Summary: Overview of the group. 
 e-Delivery Support is a business unit responsible for coordinating e-delivery process of documents. In addition, e-Delivery Support acts as a liaison between vendors, DPGs as well as internal business units. 
 
Responsibilities: 


 Liaise with complex internal and external customer issues (on-going customer servicing for various programs, resolving operational issues, and product implementations).  

 Provides advanced support on complex issues.  

 Acts as a liaison between vendors, DPGS, as well as internal and external customers.  

 Uses in-depth area knowledge to apply ingenuity and creativity to problem analysis and resolution in complex and/or novel situations.  

 Provides high level technical assistance and support on highly complex product or customer issues.  

 Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 

 Coordinate e-delivery processes for e-Delivery Support. 

 Provide training to other associates to ensure processes and procedures are followed.  

 Coordinate meetings with vendors to review issues, projects, and production schedules. 

 Participate and coordinate meetings with vendors and business units on projects. 

 Coordinate project testing with vendors and internal business units. 

 Coordinate pre-month end statement production meeting with DPGs to review statement production plans. 

 Coordinate month end statement production meeting with DPGs and internal business units.  

 Perform daily and monthly reconciliation of documents and resolve exceptions timely. 

 Document P&P and WSP and make periodic updates. 

 Coordinate Business Continuity process, BCP updates and attend monthly Team Captains meeting. 

 Review daily reconciliation reports from Associate. (Act as backup when an associate is out) 

 Coordinate email template change requests with GCR, ICE Support and vendor including testing and production implementation. 

 Coordinate the development of new projects to enhance the current e-delivery process . 

 Provide monthly scorecards and e-delivery adoption and enrollment reports. 

 Coordinate and provide information to Auditors on audit requests. 

 Respond to daily email inquiries. 

 Research and Resolve issues including reported incidents using information from Report Centers and eDocs. 

 Attend meetings for e-Delivery Support. 

 Conduct weekly e-delivery staff meetings.
