Candidate will be part of a team responsible for developing an automated DevOps framework which will facilitate continuous integration and delivery for the entire application development community.  
 Existing DevOps solutions will be expanded to incorporate various automated testing tools, security tools, JIRA integration, and Cloud support.      
 In addition, management dashboards, development team reports, and SonarQube code quality enhancements will require integration into the overall framework.      
 The ideal candidate will have both a strong technical skillset as well as “soft” skills, including: Documentation writing; PowerPoint; basic graphic design; and the ability to write 5-10 page requirement and design documents.  
 Teamwork skills are also essential since the candidate will be working on a small project team that can vary from 1-4 members.     
 Since most work will be performed on distributed systems, a general knowledge of the major systems is required.  
 In addition at least one programming language (Java) and one scripting language will be needed. Knowledge of SQL databases, particularly MS SQL Server, will be needed as well as an understanding of data base design, and data structures such as lists and trees. Finally, design skills for Business Process Management is a plus. 
     Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree is preferred, 6-8 years of experience in a systems SCM environment, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

column4: Technology Architecture and Data is the enterprise wide architecture and data services group at BNY Mellon. Our mission is to develop and articulate the holistic target state enterprise architecture and partner with various business lines and shared services to execute on a prioritized roadmap. These efforts ensure the optimal use of existing technology capabilities and the development of new ones to increase business revenue and lower costs while reducing risk, increasing resiliency, and enabling more effective service delivery. The team also formulates and executes on our data strategy to reduce complexity and eliminate redundancies in our data.   Digital Pulse is BNY Mellon’s proprietary big data analytics platform. Its mission is partner with the business and technology to deliver actionable insights to improve processes and business performance.  The Digital Pulse platform works to ensure integrity and confidence in our information.  We help to solve difficult problems and to answer the questions, “How are we doing as a firm?” and “How can we do better as a firm? Digital Pulse caters to a wide spectrum of use cases by capturing data from several hundred applications and storing it in a variety of data. The platform is designed to enable sophisticated analytics including predictive analytics and machine learning while protecting confidential data. Some of the use cases include:   ·       Improving client experience ·       Straight through processing ·       Proactive thread mitigation ·       Service level monitoring ·       Process optimization   Digital Pulse has an opening for a UI Developer.  The role requires excellent coding skills, strong command of big data platforms, an understanding of the overall direction that the industry is going, and the ability to break new ground within this environment. You must be able to translate customer business requirements into platform capabilities. Key responsibilities include:   · Works as part of the core platform engineering team to develop and maintain the Digital Pulse portal front end. · Ensures high quality delivery. Interpret and improve results. · Analyze, define and document architecture and design that addresses requirements specified by the Product Manager. · Develop according to UX standards that are established by the BNY Mellon UX team. · Communicate outcomes in a timely and accurate manner to relevant parties. · Act as an advocate for change management; encourages innovation and creativity in technology solutions. Qualifications ·  Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required·  8-10 years of experience in software development required·  Expert skill in Angular JS, React.JS, Node, HTML5, Karma, Protractor and other unit and integration testing frameworks for automated testing of modern web applications required.·  5 years of coding experience in data services required.  Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.·  Familiar with Agile (Scrum) development methodology·  Detail oriented, collaborative, and curious·  Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column4:
The Collateral & Clearance Technology group is responsible for building high-performance critical market platforms. The group designs, builds and supports the platform used for US Triparty Repo and Global Collateral Services solutions. This service has 85% of the US Triparty Repo business with $2.7trn of assets globally. This group supports the most critical client-facing services for BNY Mellon.

The group’s responsibility is building solutions to help our clients in collateral sourcing, collateral optimization and high-performance real-time  transaction processing. Our collateral optimizer was the finalist in the Franz Edelman Award – considered the highest honor in Operations Research. 

After the financial crisis, the Basel 3 regulations focused on the funding and liquidity efficiencies of the sell-side banks and the derivative margin positing for the buy-side. In order to meet these new market challenges, our group is working on building our next-generation collateral platform. The new platform will be built with strong big-data analytic capabilities to deliver to future client and regulatory requirements. Considering the mission-critical nature of the platform, we plan to invest significantly into the core engineering to address high-performance, high-availability, big-data, machine-learning and information risk at the outset.

The work environment is extremely fast-paced with very high levels of collaboration with global product managers (London & New York) and clients. 

We are looking to hire App Support members who are hands-on and able to face-off to the clients in designing solutions.
 
Specific to Support:
 

Support Online and Batch process for APAC, EMEA, US applications
Participate n the release activities and onboard the team with lower environment and then support post release
Develop Tools, Utilities to monitor and required for managing the application.
Develop and maintain the portal for support team
Actively Manage incidents and follow through the RCA process and identify GAPs and work with Delivery team to improve
Collaborate with the Infra team on the weekly patches, support validation etc.
Familiarize the various monitoring tools and ensure adoption and are leveraged within the team.
Collaborate and support business inquires and also during Triage situation. 
Liaison with the Key Clients and actively work with them during Incidents impacting them and managing the triage and communication.
Lead role also would mean to manage set of people across the globe who support this function.
Individual contributor roles would be aligned with particular service and would support the respective business service.
Great opportunity to learn and improve Business domain, Architecture and Infrastructure

column2: Principal Information Security Analyst- Adversary Hunt Program
column4:
Principal Information Security Analyst->> Consults on a senior level and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms in diverse system environments. Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. Reviews and analyzes highly complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations. Defines, implements, and applies area-wide security and/or COB policies and standards by leveraging in-depth knowledge of globally accepted information security and/or COB principles. Addresses high risk security concerns or incidents. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
   
 
 A member of the team chartered with driving the cyber security hunt program within the firm. The candidate will be responsible for: 
 •             Fulfilling technical responsibilities of the hunt team, including: 
 •             Analysis of network data (e.g., packets, logs) and endpoint data (e.g., logs, malicious artifacts) in both structured and unstructured methods. 
 •             Analysis of malware (executables, scripts, documents) to determine indicators of compromise, and create signatures for future detection of similar samples. 
 •             Conducting Red Team-style exercises to simulate attacks and gauge responsiveness of processes and procedures. 
 •             Creating a feedback loop with security control owners to help tune systems based on the results of investigations. 
 •             Acting as a high tier escalation point for security incidents to provide technical expertise to the incident response process.   Qualifications 
   
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred 10-12 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. 
 The ideal candidate will possess: 
 •             Fundamental understanding of application protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, etc.) and networking protocols (TCP, UDP, ARP, ICMP, etc.), and be comfortable analyzing packet capture (pcap) files in tools such as Wireshark; 
 •             Knowledge of operating system internals (virtual memory, paging, etc.) and techniques employed by malware to evade detection; 
 •             Proficiency in a Linux command line environment (awk, sed, grep, etc.) or Windows equivalent (Powershell) to analyze log files and other data sources and summarize data and locate anomalies; 
 •             Proficiency in a scripting language (perl, python, etc.) to automate common tasks; 
 •             Experience using SIEM tools including Splunk

column2: Vice President, Data Analyst/Data Scientist - Greenfield Infrastructure
column4:
The Sr. Specialist Data Analyst/Data Scientist will be part of the Greenfield Program in the New York City location.  
 
As you know, Greenfield is a strategic journey to modernize the application infrastructure, reduce End of Life and Critical Cyber Vulnerability risk, increase availability and reliability of the compute infrastructure, and create an agile, scalable evergreen operating model.  It is one of the largest technology enabled transformation Programs in the Financial Services sector today. 
Being part of this ground-breaking Program will be exciting, rewarding and challenging, as well as representing a significant career milestone.  You will be working with leading technology and transformation specialists, and be part of an energetic, committed and sophisticated team. 
 
Sr. Specialist Data Analyst->> Designs and creates highly complex logical/physical data models, and data dictionaries that cater to the specific business and functional requirements of applications. Consults with businesses to identify needs and translates those needs into data architecture solutions. Develops comprehensive data/technical specifications that bridge business/product needs with system design/deliverables. Performs data extracts and creates complex data reports to analyze user metrics. Develops understanding of business needs and functionalities to determine compatibility of database with existing hardware/software applications and recommend the most cost effective methods. Consults with database administration and client areas and provides solutions in resolving issues during the translation to a physical database design. Provides knowledge and expertise of enterprise data to assist the business in the creation and definition of internal and external message flows. Provides knowledge and expertise in existing database environments and makes recommendations for opportunities to share data and/or reduce data redundancy. Analyzes market trends for data modeling tools and metadata management software. Provides input into the selection of tools and any necessary migration into the company's environment. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, data entity analysis, logical and relational database design, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Qualifications 

 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required 

 8-10 years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, data entity analysis, logical and relational database design, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience required 

 Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. column3:

Jersey City, New Jersey; Nashville, Tennessee; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
column4: TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG) is the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon BXP technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers. TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing environments. Key responsibilities include:Installing, maintaining and supporting the zVM environment.Installing, maintaining and supporting the zLINUX guests under zVM.Problem and change management. Sr. Specialist Infrastructure Operations Analyst->> Designs, implements, integrates, and provides full support for complex software in a multi-tiered, multi-platform environment. Researches and recommends the appropriate system software to meet corporate standards and objectives for system performance. Identifies and solves complex and critical systems related issues to meet the objectives for the corporation. Provides input into platform selection, version implementation, software product recommendation, and usage of enhanced functionality. Assists with complex issues in the installation, support, troubleshooting, and repair of data center equipment. Implements, integrates and provides full support for middleware software in a multi-tiered, multi-platform environment. Collaborates and consults with application development teams to determine middleware platform selection, efficient transaction design, use and recovery procedures in line with business requirements. Communicates with internal and external system users to address concerns and make sure that technical issues are dealt with appropriately. Manages ticket queues and handles complex escalated issues. Analyzes repeat incident patterns to identify opportunities for cost reduction and productivity enhancements. Works with vendors to ensure efficient incident resolution. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required, advanced degree is preferred.Eight to ten (8-10) years of related infrastructure experience is required.Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.Experience in installing, maintaining and supporting zVM.Experience in creating, maintaining and supporting zLINUX guests.Knowledge of using DIRMAINT.Knowledge of RACF under zVM.Experience in Docker and Block chain implementations.       BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Analyzes application requirements and develops conceptual, logical and first-cut physical database designs (data models). Creates associated data model documentation such as entity and attribute definitions and formats. Assists in logical data designs to deliver stable and flexible high performance data solutions. Investigates and corrects data discrepancies by reconciling faulty codes. Provides data element naming consistent with standards and conventions and ensures that data dictionaries are maintained across multiple database environments (mainframe, distributed systems). Ensures data content/quality by planning and conducting moderately complex data warehouse system tests, monitoring test results and taking required corrective action. Acts as a liaison to data owners to establish necessary data stewardship responsibilities (accountability for a particular data element/verifying accuracy of the data element before loading it into the database) and procedures. Analyzes and designs data models, logical databases and relational database definitions using both forward and backward engineering techniques. Seeks opportunities to promote data sharing, and to reduce redundant data processes within the corporation by identifying common structures across application areas. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. 4-6 years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, data entity analysis, logical and relational database design, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Candidate will be part of a team responsible for developing an automated DevOps framework which will facilitate continuous integration and delivery for the entire application development community.  
 Existing DevOps solutions will be expanded to incorporate various automated testing tools, security tools, JIRA integration, and Cloud support.      
 In addition, management dashboards, development team reports, and SonarQube code quality enhancements will require integration into the overall framework.      
 The ideal candidate will have both a strong technical skillset as well as “soft” skills, including: Documentation writing; PowerPoint; basic graphic design; and the ability to write 5-10 page requirement and design documents.  
 Teamwork skills are also essential since the candidate will be working on a small project team that can vary from 1-4 members.     
 Since most work will be performed on distributed systems, a general knowledge of the major systems is required.  
 In addition at least one programming language (Java) and one scripting language will be needed. Knowledge of SQL databases, particularly MS SQL Server, will be needed as well as an understanding of data base design, and data structures such as lists and trees. Finally, design skills for Business Process Management is a plus. 
     Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree is preferred, 6-8 years of experience in a systems SCM environment, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

The desired candidate will work as a business analyst and project manager, supporting the Treasury Cash Management and Liquidity areas, in the Corporate Treasury Technology team.  The Corporate Treasury Technology team supports BNY Mellon’s fixed income and securities finance portfolio, which is a significant portion of the firm’s overall balance sheet.  The candidate will liaise with various business groups including corporate treasury front, middle and back office teams as well as various risk and enterprise technology systems in BNY Mellon.  The business analyst project manager primary objective is to design and implement technology solutions cost-effectively for projects or a program on time and within budget.  Perform all the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).  Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technology groups and secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program.             
 Responsibilities include: 


 Coordinate with the various business and technology teams to drive several key projects for critical business and regulatory initiatives in Corporate Treasury 

 Groom user stories with the team and manage all user stories into sprints. 

 Work with cross functional teams to obtain agreements all business and technology groups. 

 Creates and reviews artifacts and workflow diagrams for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).   

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Advisor to developers and providing sound judgements in a wide variety of business and technical issues. 

 Lead, execute, and coordinate the development of multiple critical tasks, often in parallel, and work directly with all stakeholders. 

 Adhere to BNY Mellon’s DLC process as well as manage issues and risks to closure. 

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Document clear data mapping to data sources as well as creating formulas for required calculations to communicate  
 The candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills (12+ years):  


 Computer Science degree or equivalent experience 

 Understanding of global payments and systems to settle financial transactions 

 Experience supporting a fixed income trading desk 

 Experience in managing small enhancements and projects  

 Experience in current and future state workflow diagrams 

 Experience in data analysis across multiple systems 

 Experience with various Agile and SDLC processes and methodologies as well as authoring the SDLC artifacts  

 Experience as Scrum Master or Product Owner 

 Experience as a Project manager 

 Understanding of C#, .Net, SQL, XML, SWIFT, FTP, messaging and reporting tools 

 Outstanding analytical skills so business needs are translated into functional and technical requirements. 

 Leadership skills  

 Program management skills 
   
 
 
 
Principal Project/Program Manager->> Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have formal management responsibility for Program Team members. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus. Qualifications  Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial 10 - 12 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus.

An Administrative Officer at the Vice President level in the Operations & Shared Services Technology group. The role reports into the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) for Operations & Shared Services Technology (O&SST), and is part of the CAO team, supporting the Chief Information Officer of O&SST. The role of the Administrative Officer is to support the day-to-day running of the organization in terms of its headcount, budgets, strategy, reporting and communication to enable better decision making at the senior leadership team level.
 
Key Responsibilities
·         Program & Project Management
o   Responsibility for administrative duties in conjunction with the team, which include but are not limited to PowerPoint composition, analytics computation, addressing requests for information, and general coordination.
o   Help the CAO team to combine technology vision and business objectives into program plans and presentations that deliver value.
 
·         Financial Management
o   Assist team leadership in formulating budget proposals based on current and anticipated growth, market conditions, strategic direction, etc. 
o   Understand the complexities of accruals, allocations, impact of capitalization, recovery, and fixed price expense in order to support strategy.
o   Support timely and accurate periodic and ad hoc financial reporting.
 
·         Workforce Management
o   Activities including headcount management, organizational chart updates, vendor and contractor management oversite support, and location strategy support — seating/space allocation.
 
·         Communications & Events
o   Events including, town halls, guest speaker, learning, code-a-thons, showcases, etc.
o   Internal team communications including emails, newsletters, Hamilton, SharePoint, Confluence, etc.
o   External team communications includes maintenance of our MySource Social content, and other content available on the corporate intranet.
 Qualifications
Key Qualifications
·         Experience in technology, finance, and/or operations is preferred.
·         Demonstrated ability to work in a team of diverse skill sets and cultures — integrity, maturity, dependability, and a positive professional attitude.
·         Strong interpersonal skills including facilitation, teaming, presentation, and communications (both oral and written) — consultative, collaborative approach to engaging others and delivering value.
·         Highly self-motivated, proactive, responsive, and organized — able to quickly prioritize, respond to, and act on requests.
·         Proficient in PowerPoint for management presentations — ability to conduct research, perform analysis, organize findings, and compile compelling rational business narratives.
·         Expert in Excel, specifically pivots, v-lookups, macros, management of large data sets, etc.
·         Experience with web, SharePoint, or Confluence site design and content management, a plus.
 Bachelor's degree in business information/systems/industrial engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, MBA preferred, 8-10 years of experience in broad-based information technology required, at least 3 years of experience in systems management and cost-effective budgetary responsibility, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. column2: Exec Manager, Project/Program Management - Info Security- Identity & Access Management Lead
column4:
Exec Manager, Project/Program Management->> Manages multiple groups of project managers who are the primary contact for clients and groups within the organization for large scale projects. Is responsible for the direction and control of IT Project Management within the firm. The team is responsible for end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation. Acts as the primary interface between technology infrastructure and a specific business/functional area. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Acts as a subject matter expert and provides guidance on highly complex technical issues. Proactively manages project management activities in a specific business/functional area. Responsible for the development of the strategic direction of the relevant IT or business area. Assists with resolution of the most complex issues on major projects. Leads recruitment strategy and manages and develops teams to maximize their collective contributions. Motivates lower level managers to maximize their contributions and encourage professional growth. Identifies business unit requirements, creates project and process specifications, coordinates with project teams and ensures that high impact projects are on schedule and to budget. Manages Project/Program Management function through group managers. Contributes to the achievement of Project/Program Management objectives.
 
   
 Role and Responsibilities:  
   


 Overall program governance and coordination with compliance, risk, and senior management  
   

 Accountability for delivery of agreed program outputs to the agreed time, cost and quality parameters within the agreed scope 
   

 Own the relationship with the delivery teams and manage a team of matrixed project managers who will be responsible for coordinating the activity of specialists, technicians and analysts to ensure that tasks are performed that result in the program deliverable   

 Ensure the program is planned in a manner that delivers to the required cost and quality and within the agreed scope, including appropriate milestone definition, work breakdown structure, dependencies, and assumptions   

 Ensure the program work is executed and implemented according to the plan or any agreed changes to the plan and according to agreed standards  

 Ensure relevant and appropriate analysis, management information, and reporting is provided   

 Ensure that appropriate meetings are held and that outputs and artifacts are produced and distributed   

 Communications with Senior Leadership Management and Risk  Committees 
   

 Chair the relevant meetings   

 Ensure that the program work is compliant with documented standards, templates, and frameworks, and captured in agreed toolsets  

 Ensure program stakeholder awareness, engagement, and communication   

 Analyze and identify possible risks and issues that could impact delivery and either resolve them or escalate as appropriate   

 Ensure the program spends according to the agreed financial plan 

 Manage program team members consistent with our management principles 

 Ensure the program closes according to required procedures   Qualifications Skills and Qualifications Required:  


 Significant experience (10+ years) in leading high profile multiyear cross business technology programs  

 Degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in Program/Project Management, Business, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science (or relevant work experience) 

 Expertise in creating presentations and dashboards for senior audiences 
 
Preferred Skills / Qualifications:


 PMP Certification 

 IAM Experience 
Advanced degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required 
12+ years of related project management experience required, experience with technology and/or the financial services industry is a plus. 
Must have extensive management experience. 
Prior experience managing projects of 10+ team members required BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Sr Specialist Information Security Analyst- Enterprise Encryption Principal
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, New York; Ashburn, Virginia; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Florham Park, New Jersey
column4:
Sr. Specialist Information Security Analyst->> Consults with other IT areas and the businesses and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms. Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. Reviews and analyzes complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations provides direction and guidance on reports and analyses and ensures recommendations are aligned with customer/business needs and capabilities. Ensures that all significant security concerns are addressed. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
  
 Description:


 The candidate will provide enterprise level guidance, assessment and direction in the development and implementation of encryption architectures, services, and solutions for the banks complex, global environment.  

 Emphasis is on validation polices, standards and procedures are followed, documentation of any gaps and escalation of any risks   

 Knowledge of implementing and evaluating data encryption systems for networks, computing platforms, and applications software.    

 Understand practical risk tradeoffs encryption systems design and implementation.  Understand the requirements for conducting a proof-of-concept test or  threat scenarios to evaluate architectural options, such as: use of different protocols, algorithms, key lengths  and key management systems; encryption at varying points in the technology stack (ref. the OSI stack); centralized vs. decentralized solutions; and solution match to requirements.  

 Familiar with centralized key management solutions.   

 Familiar with encryption technologies: TLS/SSL, full disk encryption, Hardware Security Modules (HSMs), PKI, DBMS encryption products; application Crypto API use, both wireless and wireline encryption.  

 Basic knowledge of industry encryption standards (e.g. NIST SP 800-57, ISO/IEC 18033, and FIPS 140-2).  

 Understanding of Information Security frameworks and best practices (e.g. ISO, NIST).   

 Experience with the following products is a plus: Oracle ASO/TDE, Vormetic data at rest encryption. Key management solutions (Gemalto or similar products) 

 Ability to follow encryption system requirements, standards, policies and procedures. 

 Ability to discuss encryption solutions with technical teams. 

 Excellent interpersonal/communication, presentation, and technical writing skills. 
  Qualifications  


 Minimum 10 years experience in information technology  

 Minimum 5 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required. 

 Minimum 2 years leading implementation teams or hands on implementation of encryption solutions. 

 Industry certifications such as: CISSP/SSCP, GSEC, or GCIH a plus. 

 Experience in the securities or financial services industry a plus.  
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. The desired candidate will work as a business analyst and project manager, supporting the Treasury Cash Management and Liquidity areas, in the Corporate Treasury Technology team.  The Corporate Treasury Technology team supports BNY Mellon’s fixed income and securities finance portfolio, which is a significant portion of the firm’s overall balance sheet.  The candidate will liaise with various business groups including corporate treasury front, middle and back office teams as well as various risk and enterprise technology systems in BNY Mellon.  The business analyst project manager primary objective is to design and implement technology solutions cost-effectively for projects or a program on time and within budget.  Perform all the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).  Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technology groups and secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program.             
 Responsibilities include: 


 Coordinate with the various business and technology teams to drive several key projects for critical business and regulatory initiatives in Corporate Treasury 

 Groom user stories with the team and manage all user stories into sprints. 

 Work with cross functional teams to obtain agreements all business and technology groups. 

 Creates and reviews artifacts and workflow diagrams for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).   

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Advisor to developers and providing sound judgements in a wide variety of business and technical issues. 

 Lead, execute, and coordinate the development of multiple critical tasks, often in parallel, and work directly with all stakeholders. 

 Adhere to BNY Mellon’s DLC process as well as manage issues and risks to closure. 

 Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies. 

 Document clear data mapping to data sources as well as creating formulas for required calculations to communicate  
 The candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills (12+ years):  


 Computer Science degree or equivalent experience 

 Understanding of global payments and systems to settle financial transactions 

 Experience supporting a fixed income trading desk 

 Experience in managing small enhancements and projects  

 Experience in current and future state workflow diagrams 

 Experience in data analysis across multiple systems 

 Experience with various Agile and SDLC processes and methodologies as well as authoring the SDLC artifacts  

 Experience as Scrum Master or Product Owner 

 Experience as a Project manager 

 Understanding of C#, .Net, SQL, XML, SWIFT, FTP, messaging and reporting tools 

 Outstanding analytical skills so business needs are translated into functional and technical requirements. 

 Leadership skills  

 Program management skills 
   
 
 
 
Principal Project/Program Manager->> Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Defines and manages the lifecycle from project initiation through to program closure. Manages and resolves risks, issues and dependencies. Measures and monitors program actuals, forecasts and budgets and updates plans with accurate, up-to-date information in a timely manner. Follows financial standards & processes (e.g. monthly external revenue accruals, software capitalization, procurement & external payments). Reports financial information and status to the required executive level through steering committees. Secures, leads, motivates and inspires the internal & external resources required to deliver the program. Establishes the program s governance (e.g. sponsors, approvers, stakeholders). Manages Program Office Resources. May have formal management responsibility for Program Team members. Primary Location: United States-New York- Internal Jobcode: 45190 Job: Information Technology Organization: BNY Mellon Technology-HR06363 Requisition Number: 1815552

An Administrative Officer at the Vice President level in the Operations & Shared Services Technology group. The role reports into the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) for Operations & Shared Services Technology (O&SST), and is part of the CAO team, supporting the Chief Information Officer of O&SST. The role of the Administrative Officer is to support the day-to-day running of the organization in terms of its headcount, budgets, strategy, reporting and communication to enable better decision making at the senior leadership team level.
 
Key Responsibilities
·         Program & Project Management
o   Responsibility for administrative duties in conjunction with the team, which include but are not limited to PowerPoint composition, analytics computation, addressing requests for information, and general coordination.
o   Help the CAO team to combine technology vision and business objectives into program plans and presentations that deliver value.
 
·         Financial Management
o   Assist team leadership in formulating budget proposals based on current and anticipated growth, market conditions, strategic direction, etc. 
o   Understand the complexities of accruals, allocations, impact of capitalization, recovery, and fixed price expense in order to support strategy.
o   Support timely and accurate periodic and ad hoc financial reporting.
 
·         Workforce Management
o   Activities including headcount management, organizational chart updates, vendor and contractor management oversite support, and location strategy support — seating/space allocation.
 
·         Communications & Events
o   Events including, town halls, guest speaker, learning, code-a-thons, showcases, etc.
o   Internal team communications including emails, newsletters, Hamilton, SharePoint, Confluence, etc.
o   External team communications includes maintenance of our MySource Social content, and other content available on the corporate intranet.
 Qualifications
Key Qualifications
·         Experience in technology, finance, and/or operations is preferred.
·         Demonstrated ability to work in a team of diverse skill sets and cultures — integrity, maturity, dependability, and a positive professional attitude.
·         Strong interpersonal skills including facilitation, teaming, presentation, and communications (both oral and written) — consultative, collaborative approach to engaging others and delivering value.
·         Highly self-motivated, proactive, responsive, and organized — able to quickly prioritize, respond to, and act on requests.
·         Proficient in PowerPoint for management presentations — ability to conduct research, perform analysis, organize findings, and compile compelling rational business narratives.
·         Expert in Excel, specifically pivots, v-lookups, macros, management of large data sets, etc.
·         Experience with web, SharePoint, or Confluence site design and content management, a plus.
 Bachelor's degree in business information/systems/industrial engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, MBA preferred, 8-10 years of experience in broad-based information technology required, at least 3 years of experience in systems management and cost-effective budgetary responsibility, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. column4:
Exec Manager, Project/Program Management->> Manages multiple groups of project managers who are the primary contact for clients and groups within the organization for large scale projects. Is responsible for the direction and control of IT Project Management within the firm. The team is responsible for end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation. Acts as the primary interface between technology infrastructure and a specific business/functional area. Has regular contact among peers within the firm and externally, including regulators and professional organizations. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Acts as a subject matter expert and provides guidance on highly complex technical issues. Proactively manages project management activities in a specific business/functional area. Responsible for the development of the strategic direction of the relevant IT or business area. Assists with resolution of the most complex issues on major projects. Leads recruitment strategy and manages and develops teams to maximize their collective contributions. Motivates lower level managers to maximize their contributions and encourage professional growth. Identifies business unit requirements, creates project and process specifications, coordinates with project teams and ensures that high impact projects are on schedule and to budget. Manages Project/Program Management function through group managers. Contributes to the achievement of Project/Program Management objectives.
 
   
 Role and Responsibilities:  
   


 Overall program governance and coordination with compliance, risk, and senior management  
   

 Accountability for delivery of agreed program outputs to the agreed time, cost and quality parameters within the agreed scope 
   

 Own the relationship with the delivery teams and manage a team of matrixed project managers who will be responsible for coordinating the activity of specialists, technicians and analysts to ensure that tasks are performed that result in the program deliverable   

 Ensure the program is planned in a manner that delivers to the required cost and quality and within the agreed scope, including appropriate milestone definition, work breakdown structure, dependencies, and assumptions   

 Ensure the program work is executed and implemented according to the plan or any agreed changes to the plan and according to agreed standards  

 Ensure relevant and appropriate analysis, management information, and reporting is provided   

 Ensure that appropriate meetings are held and that outputs and artifacts are produced and distributed   

 Communications with Senior Leadership Management and Risk  Committees 
   

 Chair the relevant meetings   

 Ensure that the program work is compliant with documented standards, templates, and frameworks, and captured in agreed toolsets  

 Ensure program stakeholder awareness, engagement, and communication   

 Analyze and identify possible risks and issues that could impact delivery and either resolve them or escalate as appropriate   

 Ensure the program spends according to the agreed financial plan 

 Manage program team members consistent with our management principles 

 Ensure the program closes according to required procedures   Qualifications Skills and Qualifications Required:  


 Significant experience (10+ years) in leading high profile multiyear cross business technology programs  

 Degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in Program/Project Management, Business, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science (or relevant work experience) 

 Expertise in creating presentations and dashboards for senior audiences 
 
Preferred Skills / Qualifications:


 PMP Certification 

 IAM Experience 
Advanced degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required 
12+ years of related project management experience required, experience with technology and/or the financial services industry is a plus. 
Must have extensive management experience. 
Prior experience managing projects of 10+ team members required BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Sr Specialist Information Security Analyst- Enterprise Encryption Principal
column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, New York; Ashburn, Virginia; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Florham Park, New Jersey
column4:
Sr. Specialist Information Security Analyst->> Consults with other IT areas and the businesses and provides professional support for major components of the company's information security infrastructure. Contributes to the development and implementation of security architecture, standards, procedures and guidelines for multiple platforms. Consults with the business and operational infrastructure personnel regarding new and existing technologies. Recommends new security tools to management and reports and provides guidance and expertise in their implementation. Reviews and analyzes complex data and information to provide insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations provides direction and guidance on reports and analyses and ensures recommendations are aligned with customer/business needs and capabilities. Ensures that all significant security concerns are addressed. Recommends course of action to mitigate risk and ensures that appropriate standards are established and published. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
  
 Description:


 The candidate will provide enterprise level guidance, assessment and direction in the development and implementation of encryption architectures, services, and solutions for the banks complex, global environment.  

 Emphasis is on validation polices, standards and procedures are followed, documentation of any gaps and escalation of any risks   

 Knowledge of implementing and evaluating data encryption systems for networks, computing platforms, and applications software.    

 Understand practical risk tradeoffs encryption systems design and implementation.  Understand the requirements for conducting a proof-of-concept test or  threat scenarios to evaluate architectural options, such as: use of different protocols, algorithms, key lengths  and key management systems; encryption at varying points in the technology stack (ref. the OSI stack); centralized vs. decentralized solutions; and solution match to requirements.  

 Familiar with centralized key management solutions.   

 Familiar with encryption technologies: TLS/SSL, full disk encryption, Hardware Security Modules (HSMs), PKI, DBMS encryption products; application Crypto API use, both wireless and wireline encryption.  

 Basic knowledge of industry encryption standards (e.g. NIST SP 800-57, ISO/IEC 18033, and FIPS 140-2).  

 Understanding of Information Security frameworks and best practices (e.g. ISO, NIST).   

 Experience with the following products is a plus: Oracle ASO/TDE, Vormetic data at rest encryption. Key management solutions (Gemalto or similar products) 

 Ability to follow encryption system requirements, standards, policies and procedures. 

 Ability to discuss encryption solutions with technical teams. 

 Excellent interpersonal/communication, presentation, and technical writing skills. 
  Qualifications  


 Minimum 10 years experience in information technology  

 Minimum 5 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required. 

 Minimum 2 years leading implementation teams or hands on implementation of encryption solutions. 

 Industry certifications such as: CISSP/SSCP, GSEC, or GCIH a plus. 

 Experience in the securities or financial services industry a plus.  
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. Leads and provides some direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning, and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications.  Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, requirement gathering, estimation, client management, relationship management, acceptance testing and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).  Develops iterative project plans and schedules application/infrastructure increments, including goals, risks and resource allocation.  Tailors standard processes and templates for team to elicit, challenge, and prioritize requirements, and translates into functional design and use case models. Monitors project results for significant deviations. Manages client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Applies experiences across various software and/or systems development processes to define and collect metrics and identify and implement opportunities for improvement to increase quality of requirements and speed time-to-market. Identify gaps between the current state and target model for the application and support the application manager to address these gaps. Having understanding of the third party engagement processes would be a plus and will aid in require requirement gathering, tracking, prioritization, test scripting and test execution.   
 
 
 
Sr. Specialist Project/Program Manager->> Leads and provides some direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications. Manages and oversees the end to end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the Work Structure. Develops detailed project plans and schedules application/infrastructure projects, including goals, risks and resource allocation. Monitors project results for significant deviations. Manages vendor and client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met. Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. May coordinate resources across organizational boundaries. Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.  Qualifications  

Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial, 8 - 10 years of related project management experience required, experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus.
 
 
Preferred Qualifications:

Solid Portfolio and Project Management experience/skills
Experience with Iterative methodology desired.  Also familiar with the agile processes and applying them to the Iterative process.
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.
7-10 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required; experience in the third party and risk services industry is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to multi-task with a flexible approach to changing priorities.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with all levels of the organization, from technical to Snr Mgmt.
Prior experience of working in distributed global teams.
Must have experience with MS Office Suite
Experience with web based user interface development processes. Ability to contribute to the effectiveness of UI component design and testing. column2: Sr. Specialist Project / Program Manager - Risk Management- Greenfield
column4:
Senior Specialist Project Manager to be part of the Greenfield Program in the New York City location.  
 
As you know, Greenfield is a strategic journey to modernize the application infrastructure, reduce End of Life and Critical Cyber Vulnerability risk, increase availability and reliability of the compute infrastructure, and create an agile, scalable evergreen operating model.  It is one of the largest technology enabled transformation Programs in the Financial Services sector today. 
Being part of this ground-breaking Program will be exciting, rewarding and challenging, as well as representing a significant career milestone.  You will be working with leading technology and transformation specialists, and be part of an energetic, committed and sophisticated team.  
We are looking for individuals who possess:
·     Strong program governance, project management/PMO skills with a desire to become a leader in your field
·     A desire to be part of a strategic team and develop new skills 
·     A passion for excellence and achievement
·     An ability to work in a fast paced environment
·     Drive and proactivity, and are ready to challenge the status quo
 
Major Job Responsibilities:
 
·     Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of program governance and control, and project management activities (including standards, methods and tools, KPIs and Metrics etc.).
·     Manages and oversees the end to end project management and delivery activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the Greenfield project management structure. 
·     Serves as a liaison between the Greenfield team and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. Qualifications ·     Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial
·     8 - 10 years of related project management experience required; experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus

AIS Trax is a system that is going to provide functionalities for transfer agency, fund accounting and compliance. It is going to track investor capital in and out of the fund, provide comprehensive, centralized document storage and retrieval and many more. It is the early stage of rewrite of long running production system. It is being written in modern technologies using modern techniques (Angular 6, .NET Core 2, Docker, microservices).
 
We are looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test/QA Engineer to join our agile team. In that role you will be responsible for performing all various Quality Engineering functions. Including: evaluate/design/implement/grow an automated-test architecture, planning/writing/execution and analysis of tests for all facets of our automation frameworks. You will need to be mentoring and consulting on leveraging these tools to streamline and stabilize software development process across our engineering organization.
 
You will be part of a team, which is always seeking to improve and where everyone is respected and encouraged to speak up and challenge how they do things.
 
The primary functions of the role are as follows:


 Coding/scripting automated tests 

 Take ownership over tests code quality and results.  

 Collaborate with Project Managers and Product Owners to improve requirements quality. 

 Take part in configuring CI/CD (Integration tests, UI functional testing etc.)  

 Creating and maintaining test suites according to product specifications. 

 Hands-on execution of functional (manual) testing in a client/server environment (exploratory testing, performance and stress testing) 

 Identify, report and track product defects. 

 Participation in agile based software development model 

 Proposing innovative, and creative technology solutions 

 Collaborate with internal business groups to provide adequate software solutions and design effective support processes  

 Continuously improve product quality, your personal and team work. 

 To be pro-active, participate in decision-making process, take ownership of the end result 
 Qualifications The candidate should have the following skills:


 Must have: 


 Programming (OO) and scripting skills; 

 Design patterns used in testing. 

 Knowledge of C# / Javascript / Typescript / CSS; 

 Jasmin, Karma, Protractor, Selenium, Cucumber. 

 Being familiar with version control system (preferably Git). 

 Experience in Angular based application testing. 

 Experience in creating test frameworks.  

 Strong communication skills, both face to face and with remote locations 

 Motivation, discipline and enthusiasm 

 Nice to have: 


 REST and SOAP Services (ASP.NET Web API, ASP.NET Core, WCF) 

 Experience in integration with multiple back-end systems

Description
Demonstrates expert proficiency in the design, development and implementation of data models, data warehousing, ETL processes, reporting and analytics capabilities, and database technologies and tools.
Develops and extends data architecture to support increasing user demands and application requirements.
Provides knowledge and expertise of enterprise data to lead the process of modeling the business and delivering value to the business users.
Develops logical database design through in-depth understanding of business needs and functions and available data sources.
Applies knowledge of target database technologies to develop efficient physical models from logical design.
Designs and develops correct, complete, and resilient ETL processes.
Provides expertise in reviewing and explaining data models.
Consults with business to resolve complex data issues.
Assesses and evaluates risk to understand the implications of design decisions and new technologies.
Provides occasional operational support to address processing issues.
Consults with Database Administration to tune database performance, track performance and capacity, and resolve complex issues.
Works with Production Support and Technical Services to ensure proper operation and resiliency of processing environment.
Uses expertise to evaluate market trends and provide input into the selection of tools and any necessary migration into the company's environment.
Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
Leads and mentors other team members to develop team capability.

 
 
 
 
 
Principal Architect, Data Management->> Responsible for the delivery of high quality data architectural solutions, including enterprise and line of business architectures, while ensuring compliance with company policies. Initiates and drives processes that unleash the value of the Company's data assets to gain competitive advantage in the marketplace. Strategizes and contributes to enterprise level technological initiatives on data governance, management and usage. Defines and implements data architecture for corporate data governance and database design principles. Ensures data management business solution deliveries. Adheres to the established data architecture methodologies and standards, and in compliance with company policy. Identifies organization-wide initiatives and makes recommendations for the use of data warehouse technology. Works closely with senior management to educate and to articulate resource requirements necessary to promote warehousing goals. Oversees warehousing activities of the organization to assure the strategic goals of the organization are met, and to assure integration of corporate data constructs (logical and physical database designs). Works toward architectures enterprise data solutions. Performs enterprise planning and designing solutions for emerging business and complex technology environments, including data warehousing. Identifies and recommends ways to drive more value out of the company's data. Designs stable and flexible high performance database solutions, maximizing data reuse and avoiding data redundancy, according to the current and anticipated business rules, following SDLC. Works with other stakeholders in optimizing database solutions. Contributes to the achievement of multiple teams' objectives.
 Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. 10-12 years of experience in data management services required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus
 
 
Additional Qualifications
 
5-10 years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, ETL, data entity analysis, logical and relational database design.
Experience with Informatica, Vertica, Oracle, and Unix/Linux/Shell Scripting preferred.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Experience with Finance and Accounting data is a plus.

 Description  

Responsible for design, development, testing and implementation of automated solutions that will interact with multiple third party and internal applications
Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather and analyze control requirements to establish technical as well as functional specifications for Independent Verification and Validation (IVV) of ISD (Information Security) solutions
The ability to conceptualize automated solutions and understand the prescribed design architecture
Develops automated mechanisms via scripting or process to ensure control adoption is sustainable
Present technical concepts and create detailed technical documentation
Provide technical support for IVV solutions
Analyze problems, evaluate technical issues, test, maintain, modify, integrate, monitor and ensure to automate software systems.

Assist with preparing evidence or requirements for evidence for delivery to internal audit, external audit, and regulatory inquiry.
Maintain a standard of regular reporting against our stated targets.
Ownership and accountability for technology domain projects and initiatives Qualifications  
 Required Qualifications 

Minimum two years of hands-on Linux/Unix operating systems engineering and troubleshooting
Experience with DevOps, specifically automation
Experience with web service technologies and programming/scripting languages such as Python (3.* preferred), PowerShell, bash, Selenium Automation Framework (SAF), SOAP, REST, Java, C#/.NET, HTML/XML/XAML, Go, JavaScript, Ruby, etc.
Experience with logging formats such as JSON, XML, CEF, syslog, etc.
Strong Operating System (Linux/Unix), network and security fundamentals e.g. understanding of networking protocols & applications (TCP/IP, load balancing, firewalls etc.)

Experience with software development practices – Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Agile/SCRUM, and Source Code Management (GIT), object oriented design, web development frameworks or software design patterns e.g. Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Shell Scripting in Linux/Unix environments 
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience

Experience with software verification and validation
Experience with reporting and data visualization tools, such as Splunk
Knowledge in Robotic Processing Automation
Knowledge of platform security tools (ie. Antivirus, EDR, NIDS, vulnerability scans, etc.)
Understanding of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) and developing within them
Understanding of Device and Access Controls for Linux/Unix environments
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Industry security certifications such as CISSP/SSCP or GIAC/GSEC a plus.
Masters or other advanced degree a plus

About the company:
 
TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG) is the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers.
 
What is the project about?
 
TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing environments.
 
Our Team:
 
A team of six engineers designing innovative solutions achieving high availability for critical applications through Application Delivery.
 
Technology that you are going to use:


Application Delivery – F5, AVI Networks, Cisco, Infoblox/DNS 

DevOps/NetOps – Python, Ansible, Java   
Your role would be to:


Design, implement, test & tune Application Delivery and server load balancing solutions for critical, internet facing applications. 

Provides technical direction and guidance for Application Delivery and server load balancing. 

Assess and apply future Application Delivery technologies. 

Partner and empower implementation and operational teams  

Provide escalated tier 3 operational support for web application firewall and application delivery controllers - products F5 LTM, GTM, & ASM. 

 Qualifications This role is for you if you demonstrate: 


3-5 years of experience in designing, implementing, and tier-3 support of Application Delivery and server load balancing experience with F5 products (LTM, GTM, & ASM) required

1-2 years of experience in designing and implementing Web Application Firewall

1-2 years of experience with DevOps - Python, Ansible, Java, Expect, Ruby, Perl

Experience with application delivery products (F5, Citrix, AVI...) 
What we can offer you?


 Engineering new technologies in Application Delivery  

 Technical/vendor training 

 Career Development path 

 Benefits: healthcare etc.  
 
If you feel that this role is exactly what you are looking for, feel free to apply

column2: Sr. Specialist Project / Program Manager - Risk Management- Greenfield
column4:
Senior Specialist Project Manager to be part of the Greenfield Program in the New York City location.  
 
As you know, Greenfield is a strategic journey to modernize the application infrastructure, reduce End of Life and Critical Cyber Vulnerability risk, increase availability and reliability of the compute infrastructure, and create an agile, scalable evergreen operating model.  It is one of the largest technology enabled transformation Programs in the Financial Services sector today. 
Being part of this ground-breaking Program will be exciting, rewarding and challenging, as well as representing a significant career milestone.  You will be working with leading technology and transformation specialists, and be part of an energetic, committed and sophisticated team.  
We are looking for individuals who possess:
·     Strong program governance, project management/PMO skills with a desire to become a leader in your field
·     A desire to be part of a strategic team and develop new skills 
·     A passion for excellence and achievement
·     An ability to work in a fast paced environment
·     Drive and proactivity, and are ready to challenge the status quo
 
Major Job Responsibilities:
 
·     Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of program governance and control, and project management activities (including standards, methods and tools, KPIs and Metrics etc.).
·     Manages and oversees the end to end project management and delivery activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization). Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the Greenfield project management structure. 
·     Serves as a liaison between the Greenfield team and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues. Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. Qualifications ·     Bachelor's degree, preferably in business management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is beneficial
·     8 - 10 years of related project management experience required; experience with technology or financial services industry is a plus

We are looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test/QA Engineer to join our agile team. In that role you will be responsible for performing all various Quality Engineering functions. Including: evaluate/design/implement/grow an automated-test architecture, planning/writing/execution and analysis of tests for all facets of our automation frameworks. You will need to be mentoring and consulting on leveraging these tools to streamline and stabilize software development process across our engineering organization.
 
You will be part of a team, which is always seeking to improve and where everyone is respected and encouraged to speak up and challenge how they do things.
 
The primary functions of the role are as follows:


 Coding/scripting automated tests 

 Take ownership over tests code quality and results.  

 Collaborate with Project Managers and Product Owners to improve requirements quality. 

 Take part in configuring CI/CD (Integration tests, UI functional testing etc.)  

 Creating and maintaining test suites according to product specifications. 

 Hands-on execution of functional (manual) testing in a client/server environment (exploratory testing, performance and stress testing) 

 Identify, report and track product defects. 

 Participation in agile based software development model 

 Proposing innovative, and creative technology solutions 

 Collaborate with internal business groups to provide adequate software solutions and design effective support processes  

 Continuously improve product quality, your personal and team work. 

 To be pro-active, participate in decision-making process, take ownership of the end result
