column2: DevOps Developer (Java, J2EE, REST Web Services)
column4:
Securities Data Service is a provider of reference and market data to many business lines within BNY Mellon.  As part of our Technology Roadmap, we are focused on the modernization, re-engineering, and delivery of our software and hardware components into the Greenfield environment. Candidate will own the development and support of the technology solutions moving to Greenfield.  Effort to move to this environment will include hardware upgrades, migration of our Vendor data feeds, and modernization of legacy components. Important part of the future efforts is incorporating resiliency and stability into the existing processes and ensuring they are covered by future development. The candidate must be proactive in finding solutions for existing issues and be able to work well with other development resources, collaborating with internal/offshore and external teams on projects. 

Primary Job Responsibilities to Include:

Contributing to and delivering on our modernization and transformation roadmap.
·         Migrating legacy code to strategic platforms by designing and developing micro services, cloud based solutions. 
·         Design/Develop/code end to end distributed technology solutions for BNY Securities Data Services Team.
 Specialist Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Coordinates coding, testing, implementation and documentation of solution. Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Manage Major Expenditure/Deal Process partnering with Procurement, Capital Controllers, Major Expenditures and Accounts Payable. column2: Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management)
column4:
Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management) 
The desired candidate will work as a developer on our Asset and Liability Management (ALM) applications for the Treasury and Finance Group’s enhancements. The candidate will consult with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services and technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
 
Job Purpose: 
The candidate will work closely with our Technology Teams in India, New York, Manchester and Pittsburgh. The candidate will be responsible for development and systems analysis for various course of business and production support enhancements to continue building out, maintaining, and supporting this critical platform. This will involve:

Application development to support new features, requests, fixes, etc., for the existing development queue and new projects as needed. 
Development work related to CCAR, which will include data tagging, reporting and the building out of historical data sets. 
Be able to read, understand and perform fixes to code in support of daily regulatory reports. 
Work on new business, both project related and course of business. 
Escalate and address any issues affecting daily and monthly batch procedures that may impact delivery to our business users.
The ALM platform is comprised of a large data warehouse built using Microsoft technologies used for optimizing Net Interest Income and for reporting to senior/executive management as well as regulatory bodies (e.g. Basel III, LCR and 5G, CCAR, Federal Reserve). Working on this platform, the candidate will get exposure to many different aspects of the firm.  
 Qualifications
Large data warehouse environment. This includes Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, and .NET, Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java. S/he must be able to work with the Application Development QA Team to develop testing scripts. S/he must be proactive in finding solutions and able to work well with other Development resources, both onshore and offshore, to provide timely and accurate implementations. 
The preferred candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills:
 
·       Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
·       Advanced knowledge and extensive experience working with SQL
·       Experience working within global teams across different locations
·       Experience working with large volumes of data within a data warehouse
·       Experience working with Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java 
·       Working knowledge of data warehouse technical concepts and designs
·       Working knowledge of technical concepts and designs for business intelligence & adhoc/query reporting 
·       Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS stack
·       Experience working with offshore development teams
·       Excellent oral and written communication skills
·       Advanced skills working with Microsoft Excel
·       Financial industry knowledge, especially as it relates to a balance sheet, is preferred. This includes the types of instruments held by a banking institution for its day to day operations. 
 
In addition to domain and technical expertise, this individual is an expert in prioritization and management. S/he demonstrates a deep understanding of end-to-end operation flows across multiple system applications, expertise and experience with Agile Software Development Life Cycle processes and methodologies, extensive leadership skills, and a deep understanding of application architecture is desired.

column2: DevOps Developer (Java, J2EE, REST Web Services)
column4:
Securities Data Service is a provider of reference and market data to many business lines within BNY Mellon.  As part of our Technology Roadmap, we are focused on the modernization, re-engineering, and delivery of our software and hardware components into the Greenfield environment. Candidate will own the development and support of the technology solutions moving to Greenfield.  Effort to move to this environment will include hardware upgrades, migration of our Vendor data feeds, and modernization of legacy components. Important part of the future efforts is incorporating resiliency and stability into the existing processes and ensuring they are covered by future development. The candidate must be proactive in finding solutions for existing issues and be able to work well with other development resources, collaborating with internal/offshore and external teams on projects. 

Primary Job Responsibilities to Include:

Contributing to and delivering on our modernization and transformation roadmap.
·         Migrating legacy code to strategic platforms by designing and developing micro services, cloud based solutions. 
·         Design/Develop/code end to end distributed technology solutions for BNY Securities Data Services Team.
 Specialist Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Coordinates coding, testing, implementation and documentation of solution. Ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.  Qualifications 
6-8 yrs. technology experience with 5+ yrs. experience as a technology lead
Advanced degree in computer science or related discipline. Minimum 5-7 Years’ coding experience required.
Experience with Vendor Market Data is advantageous. as SMDB interfaces with 24 unique market vendors and sources over 400 daily feeds,
Exposure to the AIM Software and reference data management as we Integrate GAIN Data Portal application into the Greenfield space and retire sub-systems. 
Development experience in a java web environment (Java, J2EE, REST web services)
Experience with relational databases (e.g. SQL Server, Oracle). Conversant in Big Data / NoSQL (Cassandra, Hadoop, MongoDB, etc.) a plus.
Experience using DevOps software (Maven, Jenkins, Git, etc.)
Strong communication and risk management skills. Preferable Skills:

C++ and ETL knowledge a plus.
Experience working in Unix/Linux environments and Web Application Servers.
A level of domain knowledge in the financial services industry.
Knowledge / Experience with Agile a plus.
Experience of test driven development, automated build and testing tools.

As a Senior Application Support Analyst for Corporate Treasury and Finance, you will have a production services support role for a suite of applications and services.  A support analyst will be primarily involved with incident, problem, and change management in the production environment as well as supporting the QA environment for select applications. 
 You will be part of a global support team working in a dynamic environment where you’ll have an opportunity to make a significant impact and work with a broad range of the latest technologies.

 ·       Manage escalations and coordinate support across the required applications and services 
 ·       Ability to deal with time sensitive issues in support of critical service level commitments

 ·       Create and maintain support documentation and procedures 
·       Maintain effective relationships across infrastructure, development, and other shared services teams

column2: Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management)
column4:
Sr. Specialist Developer – ALM (Asset and Liability Management) 
The desired candidate will work as a developer on our Asset and Liability Management (ALM) applications for the Treasury and Finance Group’s enhancements. The candidate will consult with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services and technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. 
 
Job Purpose: 
The candidate will work closely with our Technology Teams in India, New York, Manchester and Pittsburgh. The candidate will be responsible for development and systems analysis for various course of business and production support enhancements to continue building out, maintaining, and supporting this critical platform. This will involve:

Application development to support new features, requests, fixes, etc., for the existing development queue and new projects as needed. 
Development work related to CCAR, which will include data tagging, reporting and the building out of historical data sets. 
Be able to read, understand and perform fixes to code in support of daily regulatory reports. 
Work on new business, both project related and course of business. 
Escalate and address any issues affecting daily and monthly batch procedures that may impact delivery to our business users.
The ALM platform is comprised of a large data warehouse built using Microsoft technologies used for optimizing Net Interest Income and for reporting to senior/executive management as well as regulatory bodies (e.g. Basel III, LCR and 5G, CCAR, Federal Reserve). Working on this platform, the candidate will get exposure to many different aspects of the firm.  
 Qualifications
Large data warehouse environment. This includes Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, and .NET, Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java. S/he must be able to work with the Application Development QA Team to develop testing scripts. S/he must be proactive in finding solutions and able to work well with other Development resources, both onshore and offshore, to provide timely and accurate implementations. 
The preferred candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills:
 
·       Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
·       Advanced knowledge and extensive experience working with SQL
·       Experience working within global teams across different locations
·       Experience working with large volumes of data within a data warehouse
·       Experience working with Angular, API, Pentaho, and Java 
·       Working knowledge of data warehouse technical concepts and designs
·       Working knowledge of technical concepts and designs for business intelligence & adhoc/query reporting 
·       Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS stack
·       Experience working with offshore development teams
·       Excellent oral and written communication skills
·       Advanced skills working with Microsoft Excel
·       Financial industry knowledge, especially as it relates to a balance sheet, is preferred. This includes the types of instruments held by a banking institution for its day to day operations. 
 
In addition to domain and technical expertise, this individual is an expert in prioritization and management. S/he demonstrates a deep understanding of end-to-end operation flows across multiple system applications, expertise and experience with Agile Software Development Life Cycle processes and methodologies, extensive leadership skills, and a deep understanding of application architecture is desired.

Performs systems management and integration functions. Conducts and leads analysis to correct systems, applications, software, and hardware that are not compliant with Corporate policy/procedures. Works closely with external vendors on large infrastructure engineering projects. Works closely with Application Development and Quality Assurance and Testing teams to understand infrastructure needs during the development and testing processes. Applies IT expertise in strategizing how to best develop infrastructure that will allow development and testing processes to be secure and efficient.Provides input and recommends processes in developing project plans. Monitors project progress and provides regular status reports to management team. Evaluates the effectiveness of the organization's existing infrastructure technology. Stays informed of current industry trends and emerging technologies. Researches and analyzes trends to recommend and implement upgrades that enhance the reliability and efficiency of the IT infrastructure. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
 
 Description  

Responsible for design, development, testing and implementation of automated solutions that will interact with multiple third party and internal applications
Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather and analyze control requirements to establish technical as well as functional specifications for Independent Verification and Validation (IVV) of ISD (Information Security) solutions
The ability to conceptualize automated solutions and understand the prescribed design architecture
Develops automated mechanisms via scripting or process to ensure control adoption is sustainable
Present technical concepts and create detailed technical documentation
Provide technical support for IVV solutions
Analyze problems, evaluate technical issues, test, maintain, modify, integrate, monitor and ensure to automate software systems.

Assist with preparing evidence or requirements for evidence for delivery to internal audit, external audit, and regulatory inquiry.
Maintain a standard of regular reporting against our stated targets.
Ownership and accountability for technology domain projects and initiatives Qualifications 
 Required Qualifications 

Minimum one year of hands-on Windows operating systems engineering and troubleshooting
Experience with DevOps, specifically automation
Experience with web service technologies and programming/scripting languages such as Python (3.* preferred), PowerShell, batch, Selenium Automation Framework (SAF), SOAP, REST, Java, C#/.NET, HTML/XML/XAML, Go, JavaScript, Ruby, etc.
Experience with logging formats such as JSON, XML, CEF, syslog, etc.
Strong Operating System (Windows), network and security fundamentals e.g. understanding of networking protocols & applications (TCP/IP, load balancing, firewalls etc.)
Ability to work with Databases - SQL queries
Experience with software development practices – Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Agile/SCRUM, and Source Code Management (GIT), object oriented design, web development frameworks or software design patterns e.g. Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Shell Scripting in Windows environments 
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience
 Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with software verification and validation
Experience with reporting and data visualization tools, such as Splunk
Knowledge in Robotic Processing Automation
Knowledge of platform security tools (ie. Antivirus, EDR, NIDS, vulnerability scans, etc.)
Understanding of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) and developing within them
Understanding of Device and Access Controls for Windows environments
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Industry security certifications such as CISSP/SSCP or GIAC/GSEC a plus.
Masters or other advanced degree a plus
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 8-10 years of related experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus. column2: Sr. Specialist Developer (HCM PeopleSoft Administrator - HRMS, Payroll and Self Service)
column3:
Multiple Locations:
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; New York, New York
column4:
BNY Mellon is seeking an experienced PeopleSoft Administrator. This position is a lead position with responsibility for maintaining PeopleSoft (v9.2) HCM modules (HRMS, Payroll and Self Service) and supporting interfaces.  
   
 This position provides day to day and on-going support for the global PeopleSoft HR application. Position requires candidate to have comprehensive PeopleSoft knowledge – from both a development and Administrator perspective.  
   
 Additionally, candidate must have experience with PeopleTools 8.5x and above, applying PUM images, and Tools upgrades. S/he will also have proven experience with PeopleSoft Approval Workflow Engine, Component Interface, Integration Broker and PeopleSoft Internet Architecture (PIA). 
   
 
Sr. Specialist Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs using BNY Mellon's standard development methodology. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Contributes to defining time tables and project plans. Analyzes and estimates feasibility, cost, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs. Takes lead for establishing, implementing and monitoring 'best practices' for technical development methodologies and tools. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives. Qualifications 
2+ years PeopleSoft Development experience plus 2+ years PeopleSoft Admin experience
2+ years PeopleTools 8.5x experience
Technical knowledge and experience with PeopleSoft v9.2 HR/Payroll/Self Service and Manager Self Service modules, PeopleTools v8.5x, PeopleCode, Application Engine, SQR, PeopleSoft Messaging, Import Manager, Payroll Interface and Data Mover, Oracle, Oracle Utilities, SQL, Perl
Java, HTML5 and Angular JS experience is a plus
Hands on PeopleSoft upgrade experience – participation as the technical lead preferred
Extensive knowledge of Oracle RDBMS including space management, writing and tuning SQL statements, table sizing, schema maintenance. 
Experience with PeopleSoft version upgrades
Extensive knowledge of the Linux/Unix operating system
Very organized, capable of managing several concurrent initiatives
Thorough understanding of development and testing methodologies.
 
Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8-10 years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
